Milk and meat selling brings 200 AZN income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use a yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Asif applied for a loan of 700 AZN to purchase one milking cow and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest and Asif has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Mareth

texts.en: Mareth, 60, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food and drinks for over seven years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband and two of her children are employed in the rice mill. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mareth is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more drinks to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a house with five rooms to rent for garment workers and help her children get a Bachelor Degree.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nyanchiek

texts.en:
Nyanchiek lives in Bor. She sells food and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school. 

Nyanchiek heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Chanthy, 43, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a barber who earns about USD 5 per day. In order develop her family’s economy, Chanthy is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cattle to resell for a profitable price. This loan would enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 50 years old and married with three children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sakina has been breeding sheep and cows for the last five years. When she retired, she was left without her daily bread, as her pension is only 60 AZN. She decided to start her business and with the help of her father, who was breeding animals for his entire life, they purchased their first cattle.

Sakina usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 3-5 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sakina also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,200 AZN loan to purchase five sheep, one milking cow and fodder.  This will be her second loan from AqroInvest CU and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy five sheep, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Sanna

texts.en:
Sanna lives in Bor. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are still in school. 

Sanna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 SDG in order to purchase beans and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and oil to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng, 67, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying rice to sell for a profitable price for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD 3 per day. All of her children are employed in the garment factory. They earn approximately USD 9 per day. In order to improve her business, Heng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more rice to re-sell. By doing so, she would generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use further profits to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Saven, 39, is widowed and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a business of buying palm leaf thatches for resale for a profitable price for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. 

Two of her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a construction worker. They earn approximately USD 6 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Saven is requesting a loan of USD 700 to raise capital for her business to buy more palm leaf thatches for resale, in order to generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the extra profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy more palm leaf thatches for resale

loans.name: Lusik

texts.en:
Lusik is 48 years old. She lives in Sisian with her husband and two sons. 

The main income for the family comes from a fish breeding business, that they started two years ago. 

Lusik has applied for this loan to expand the business. She will use the loan amount to purchase 4,000 little fishes and 24 bags of food for them. Lusik has all the conditions to grow the fish and sell at high prices. 

With the additional income, Lusik will improve the living conditions in her household and insure a higher quality of life for her son's future family.

loans.use: to buy more fishes and food to feed them

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a young farmer from Hatsavan village. He runs a farm, where he cultivates potatoes, beans and corn and breeds sheep. 

Vardan is a very hard working and purposeful person; due to these qualities he has managed to develop the farm himself after his parents. The farm now has all the necessary conditions needed for expansion: a barn for the cattle and an agricultural tractor. 

Vardan has applied for this loan to complete the land cultivation process, for which he needs to purchase the necessary seeds, fertilizer and fuel. Besides this, Vardan also will purchase forage to feed the sheep. 

Vardan has recently become a father and he is willing to create prosperous living conditions for his newborn daughter and his wife, as well as his mother. The development of agriculture will give him the opportunity to implement these goals.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, fuel and forage

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old and a business lady. She is a single mother of one child. 

She has been running a cafeteria for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Jennifer will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil for use in the cafeteria. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Martun

texts.en:
Martun is 38 years old. He is a father of a big family: his wife and three children. Martun's parents also live with the family. 

Martun works at the local village hall. As his salary is low and is not enough to cover the family's costs, Martun also runs a farm, where he cultivates land and breeds cattle. 

Due to his hard work, he has increased the number of cows from four to fifteen. Martun has applied for this loan to develop his farm. With the requested amount he plans to purchase nine calves. This will allow Martun to increase his income from agriculture, which is important for him to sustain the family and ensure a financially stable future for the children.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 37 years old. He lives in the village of Pkhvenisi, East Georgia with his big family: wife Tea, a five-year-old daughter, parents, an elder sister and his 80-year-old grandmother. Kakha’s wife and mother are teachers and work in a local school. 

Kakha heads the family agricultural business. They own a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Kakha produces Georgian cheese and sells it locally. He also cultivates the family owned 1.3 hectares of land and grows tomatoes, beat, cabbages and apple trees on the plot. He sells the harvested products at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the seven member family is 1000 Laris.

Kakha requested credit to purchase a mini (manual) tractor for tilling his plot and fertilizers. He will save the costs, which he used to incur for renting a tractor for tilling the plot. Also, he will be able to rent his mini tractor to neighborhood farmers and get additional income. The income of the family will increase. 

Kakha plans to reinvest part of the increased income into the further development of the family farm. In particular, he wants to purchase additional agricultural land. Also, part of the income will be used for purchasing necessary household goods, to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini (manual) tractor and fertilizers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old, married to James and is blessed with seven children aged between four months and 15 years old. She sells charcoal, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase trees for charcoal production. The profit from her business will help her to buy a dairy cow for milk production. 

Her dream is to see her business expand and to educate her children. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase trees for charcoal production.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 34 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is single and has four children between two to sixteen years old, all of them live at home.

For the past four years, she has been selling chicken feet and pig feet in the market. She enjoys the buying for the business, She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken feet and pig feet for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feet and pig feet for her business

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and son. Andrey works in the Army and his wife works at Meghri city hall. 

To have a source of income and become more independent, the couple started running a farm three years ago. Now Andrey needs some financial investments to expand his farm. He plans to use the requested amount to purchase two cows and forage to feed the cattle. 

Andrey dreams of creating a big farm, where he will breed different kinds of animals. The current expansion of the farm will allow Andrey to start successfully implementing of his dream.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rehab is 23 years old, she is a business lady and is married to David, who is also a business man. They are blessed with one child. 

She has been running a greengrocer business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Rehab will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married and has 11 children between the ages of six and 30 years old, six of them are currently in school and live at home, while the others are on their own. Her husband is a Firestone worker.

For the past twenty years, she has been selling rice, oil and pepper in the market. She enjoys the profit she receives from her business, She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business

loans.name: Eliza G.

texts.en:
Eliza lives in the Airport community. She is 44 years old and married with five children between 15 to 23 years old, all of them are currently in school and live at home. Her husband is working with Firestone.

For the past eleven years, she has been selling charcoal in the market. She enjoys the profit from the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.

Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 54 years old and is a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Joseph, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with six children. 

She has been in the farming business for two years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Grace will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the farming business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Azogueñitas (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Azogueñitas está formado por 9 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Azogues, conocida como la “Obrera del Sur”, Azogues es una ciudad pequeña con una arquitectura que se ha conservado a través de los tiempos, su gente basa su economía en la actividad agraria, cría de animales y en la artesanía, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son mujeres amables, gentiles que laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Transito, tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 30, 24, 22, 16 y 11 años de edad, su tercer hijo está estudiando en la universidad, su cuarto hijo está en el colegio y su ultimo hijo se encuentra en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María Transito es comerciante hace 20 años, ella viaja a diferentes lugares del país a comprar mercadería como ropa, calzado, cerámicas etc. que vende luego en su ciudad, también tiene una tienda en la cual labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su tiempo libre se dedica en la agricultura. 

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de ropa y zapatos para su negocio.
 
Su meta es convertir su tienda en un mini mercado.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Azogueñitas community bank has nine members who live in different parts of the city of Azogues which is known as the 'Obrera del Sur' (Worker of the South).  Azogues is a small city whose architecture has been preserved through time.  The local people farm, raise animals and make handicrafts.  They maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  The members of this bank are kind women who work in different business activities which allow them to improve their household finances and provide for their children.

One of the members of this group is María Transito who is 50 years old, married, and has five children from her marriage who are 30, 24, 22, 16 and 11 years old.  Her third child is studying at university, her fourth is in high school and her youngest is attending elementary school in the city.  Her husband is a salesman and the house in which they live is their own,

María Transito has been a saleswoman for 20 years.  She travels to different parts of the country to buy merchandise such as clothing, footwear, pottery, etc. which she later sells in her city.  She also has a store where she works from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.  In her free time she farms.

María is a founding member of her community bank and she will invest her new loan in buying clothing and shoes for her business.  Her goal is to turn her store into a mini-market.

n.b. The small photo is of a member who wasn't able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne has 3 children aged between 2 and 11. She sells foodstuffs, a business which she has been running for the past 2 years. With the loan she will buy more foodstuffs to sell. She wants to use the profits to reinvest in the business. In the future, Jeanne would like to see her business expanding to a high level, such as a distributor.The picture was taken at the UOB lending staff office.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Maria De  Jesus

texts.es: La señora María es  una persona  muy responsable que  a lo largo de  sus créditos  en la  institución se  a distinguido  por tener  una  excelente  cultura  de  pagos, ella   actualmente  cuanta  con una tienda de abarrotes  que  junto  con  su  esposo  a  sacado  adelante  día  con día  y  les    permitido  brindar  a su  familia  una  excelente  estabilidad  económica,  en esta  ocasión  necesita  de  nuestra  ayuda   ya que  requiere   realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía  para   el  negocio,  ya  que  nos  comenta  que  se  preocupa  por brindarles a  sus  clientes   los  diferentes  productos  cuando  así lo requieren, agradece el  apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: María is a very responsible person who, throughout her time receiving loans from the institution, has distinguished herself by having an excellent repayment record.  She currently has a grocery store that she and her husband have made progress in day by day and which has allowed them to provide their family with excellent financial stability.  On this occasion, she needs our help as she needs to buy merchandise for her business.  She tells us that she tries to provide her customers with different products when they need them.  She is grateful for the support she will receive in carrying out her project.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Nickelodeon Group

texts.es:
Adela, integrante del grupo Nickelodeon, esta muy agradecida de haber sido invitada, formado por iniciativa de sus vecinas, a este crédito grupal para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes y proveerlo de mercancía. 
Ella es madre de dos hijos, y hace unos meses decidió poner este negocio en casa, para ofrecer productos de necesidades básicas del hogar pues lo vio prometedor debido a que habita en una colonia de reciente construcción.
Esta premonición fue buena, pues ha tenido buena temporada de ventas y ha ido incluyendo variedad a sus productos.
Ella ahora se esta comprometiendo con este préstamo, para poder invertir en inventario para su abarrotera y con ello crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Nickelodeon group.  She is very grateful that her group was created through her neighbors' initiative.  She will use her part of this group loan to invest in her grocery store and stock it with merchandise.

Adela is the mother of two children and, a few months ago, she decided to set up a business in her home where she could sell basic household products.  She saw this as good potential business as she lives in a recently constructed development.

Adela's intuition was correct as she has enjoyed good sales and has gradually added variety to her stock.  She is now taking part in this group loan so that she can invest in buying stock for her grocery store and thereby grow her business.

loans.use: to invest in stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Doña Mirta sigue con su negocio de pulperia, en donde ha invertido mas en su inversion al poder vender mas producto de refrigeracion, el cual  compro  una mas grande, capital obtenido mediante el financiamiento, su esposo le apoya con el negocio, el trabaja en carpinteria y cuando tiene poco trabajo despacha en la venta.
Hoy en dia doña Mirta ayuda a sus padres que estan ancianos siendo una bendicion para ella,  es por tal razon se esfuerza para tener ventas altas, logrando tener ingresos que ayuden a mantener el medicamentos de sus padres.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: seis vidones de aceite, ocho quintales de arroz, cinco quintales de frijoles, ocho quintales de azucar y embutidos,frutas y verduras logrando mantener el grano basico, siendo el mas demandado por los clientes.
texts.en:
Mirta continues in her grocery store business.  She has invested some more in her business and is now able to sell more refrigerated goods as she bought a larger refrigerated display case with capital she obtained through her previous loan.  Her husband supports her with her business.  He works as a carpenter and when he doesn't have much work on he helps serve in the store.  

Mirta is now helping her parents who are elderly.  She works hard so that her sales are good and she makes the income she needs to help provide her parents with their medicines.

Mirta will use this new loan to buy six containers of oil, eight 100lb bags of rice, five 100lb bags of beans, eight 100lb bags of sugar, cold cuts, fruit and vegetables.  This will enable her to maintain her level of basic grains which are the most popular products with her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Arnoldo continua con su pulperia, aumentando su inventario, para el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual Afodenic ha venido hacer un medio para este logro.
Hoy en dia esta trabajando fijo, como conductor, lo que ha venido a mejorar sus ingresos para el gasto personal de sus tres hijos los cuales estudian, el negocio lo esta administrando su esposa, en donde solo por las noches el ayuda a despachar.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: diez quintales de frijoles, arroz, azucar, vidon de aceite, cereales, productos lacteos, productos de la coca cola, en donde son productos muy comprados por su clientela, en donde el cliente es lo primero, y asi mantener sus ventas.
texts.en:
Arnoldo continues in his grocery store business, increasing his stock so that he can grow his business, thanks to Afodenic who provide a way for him to achieve this.  Arnoldo now has a regular job as a driver which has improved his income which he uses to cover the personal expenses of his three children who are in school.  His wife is now running the business and he helps her serve there only in the evenings.

Arnoldo will use this new loan to buy ten 100lb bags of beans, rice and sugar, containers of oil, cereals, dairy products and Coca Cola products.  These are products that his customers buy a lot of.  His customers come first and this is how he maintains his sales.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es: Luis vive en Teustepe, municipio de Boaco  casado, tiene dos hijos, tiene un taller de vulcanización. Empezó a trabajar a los 12  años y a los 15 se independizo y puso su primer taller además tiene un pequeño kiosco dentro de su vulcanizadora en el cual cuenta con la administración de su esposa. Tiene como expectativa ampliar más su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio. El solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosa, galleta, meneítos, chicles, diversos tipos de golosinas  esto le ayudara a tener más surtido su kiosco y atraer a los compradores. Considera que esta en un lugar  propicio  muy trascurrido ya que es un lugar de parada de buses. Sus planes futuros es mejorar las condiciones de su taller y seguir  ayudando a su esposa en su kiosco.
texts.en: Luis lives in Teustepe, in the municipality of Boaco.  He is married and has two children.  Luis owns a tire repair shop.  He started working at the age of 12 and at 15 he started working for himself and set up his first workshop.  He also has a small kiosk inside his tire repair shop which his wife runs.  He plans to further expand his business so that he can provide his customers with a better service.  He is requesting this loan to buy soda, cookies, 'meneitos' (puffed corn snacks), gum and different types of candies.  This will help him to keep his kiosk better stocked and attract buyers.  He considers his business to be in a good location.  It is very busy as there are bus stops nearby.  Luis' future plans are to improve the condition of his workshop and to continue helping his wife with her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy soda, cookies, meneitos (puffed corn snacks), gum and candies

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina was born and grew up in the city of Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia. In 2005, she finished high school but she did not continue through college because of financial constraints. She is single and recently she moved from her hometown of Lusaka to a nearby town, Chongwe, to start up her own mobile money business. She lives alone in a rented house not very far from where her shop is located. 

The biggest business successes that Tina's business has achieved according to her is its early profitability which has allowed her to devote herself 100% to her own business, even though the profit margins are still small. She is hopeful that once she gets a Kiva loan she will be able to pay in full for her trading booth which she uses to serve her customers. She promises to make her payments on time. 

After experiencing some early business success, Tina is very excited to continue growing her business. She offers reliable money transfers to her new community and the difference in service and price can be seen immediately. According to Tina, before she started her business the people in her new community used unsafe and mostly expensive ways to move their money such as giving cash to a passing bus driver to deliver. She takes pride in the knowledge that her small business has made it possible for them to move money easily and safely. 

Tina has many dreams for her future. At 25 years of age, she hopes to go back to school someday and study accounting. She also hopes to employ more people to help her at her shop as she currently only has one employee.

loans.use: To pay in full for her trading booth which she uses to serve her customers

loans.name: Pablo Oracio

texts.es: Pablo de 40 años de edad vive en la comarca  llamada el  Cacao  municipio de Boaco, casado, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando su primaria en una escuelita cercana a la comunidad donde ellos viven , de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra y venta de granos básicos como es el frijol y maíz  desde hace 20 años. El empezó a trabajando  con sus padre en la siembra. Al  casarse su padre le regalo un pedazo de tierra para hacer su casa de ahí empezó con  la siembra de maíz y frijol  de manera independiente. Hoy en día uno de sus hijos le ayuda a sembrar después de la escuela. La mayoría de los habitantes de la comarca  sobreviven de la producción que siembran por eso es de mucha importancia. El solicito el préstamo para pago de mano de obra, compra de insumo de siembra de maíz ya que el ciclo productivo de siembra esta por comenzar. Unos de sus planes futuros son mejorar la infraestructura de su casa  y sacar  a sus hijos  al pueblo a estudiar su secundaria para brindarle una mejor educación sus metas próximas es vender el maíz a un buen precio  y comprar dos vaquillas.
texts.en:
Pablo is 40 years old and lives in el Cacao, in the municipality of Boaco.  He is married and has three children who are attending an elementary school not far from their community.  Pablo is a farmer who has been growing and selling basic grains such as beans and corn for the past 20 years.  He started out working with his parents.  When he got married, his father gave him a plot of land on which to build his house and this is where he started growing corn and beans independently.  Now one of Pablo's children helps him to sow his crops after school.  Most of the people in Pablo's area survive on what they grow which makes it very important.

Pablo requested this loan to pay laborers and to buy supplies for sowing corn as the sowing season is about to start.  Some of his future plans are to improve the infrastructure of his home and to take his children to town so that they can complete their secondary education.  This will provide them with a better education.  His short-term goals are to sell his corn for a good price and to buy two heifers.

loans.use: to pay laborers and buy supplies for sowing corn

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 28 years old. He runs his own local mobile money transfer business which he has been running for one year now. He describes his business as simply the sending and receiving of money electronically. Currently, Paul does not have enough working capital. He is not able to serve customers who want to send large amounts of money. This saddens him as he has to turn away customers and lose out on commissions. 

He believes that his community benefits from his business because he offers them an easy and quick way of sending money and he works hard to give them the best customer service. 

He has grown the number of transaction he does in a day. He has gone from only 10 transactions a day to an impressive 60. He has since managed to employ one person to help him in his shop. Paul describes his life as difficult; he is quick to say that he has not had it easy in life due to being orphaned at the young age of 10. He has not been able to pursue his education, but is grateful for the opportunity he has to run his own business and therefore gives it all he can. 

Paul's appeal to his lenders is that they help him raise the money so that he can let his customers send larger amounts of money. He has dreams of opening more mobile money outlets in his town. 

In this video, Paul is interviewed by a representative from Mobile Transactions.

loans.use: To increase his working capital so that customers can send large amounts of money from his shop

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo vive en la comarca llamada  Potrillo ubicada en el municipio de Boaco, casado, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta estudiando.  Es de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo. Inicio a trabajar a los 12 años, luego se caso y con la herencia que le dejo el papa de la esposa empezaron a trabajar juntos; hoy en día cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y con el ingreso que gana su esposa como domestica.  Tiene como expectativa sacar su cosecha este año para darla a buen precio y tener más ganancias. El crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de semilla de frijol y para iniciar las labores de rasado (limpieza y preparación del terreno para sembrar) del terreno, esto le ayudara para cuando salga la producción retenerlo para en mayo venderlo a un buen precio por lo tanto tener una buena ganancia. Sus planes futuros son mejorar su casa con los ingresos que obtenga de la cosecha, sus metas próximas es tener limpio el terreno para la próximas cosecha ya que para esa fecha la mano de obra es difícil.
texts.en: Domingo lives in Potrillo, in the municipality of Boaco.  He is married and has three children.  Only his youngest child is still in school.  Domingo is a farmer who grows corn, beans and wheat.  He started work at the age of 12 then got married and, using an inheritance from his wife's father, he and his wife started working together.  He now has the help of his children and the income his wife earns as a domestic employee.  Domingo hopes that this year's harvest will fetch him a good price and make him more profits.  He is requesting a loan to buy bean seeds and to start his tasks weeding and preparing his land for sowing.  This will help him to hold back his crops when they are ready and then sell them in May for a good price, making good profits.  His future plans are to improve his house with the income that he makes from his harvest.  His short-term goal is to have his land weed free for his upcoming harvest because obtaining laborers at that time is difficult.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Don Alberto es originario de la comarca Cosirisne localizada en las afueras del  municipio de Boaco, tiene  60 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos que comercializa en la comunidad; desde muy pequeño siempre a estado trabajando y cuidando a su madre ya que sus otros hermanos viven aparte,  como apoyo el paga la mano de obra de la siembra,  al finalizar la siembra,  el alquila su potrero para ganado y así tener otros ingresos. Sus expectativas es sacar un buen rendimiento de su cosecha este año. Solicita este crédito para la compra de semilla, pago de mano de obra para la siembra de  maíz y frijol. Esto le ayudara  comprar los insumos  para sacar la cosecha a tiempo y aprovechar las lluvias de mayo. Tiene como planes futuras  mejorar la casa en la que vive solo con su mamá ya que ella esta muy ancianita y necesita mucho cuido, en sus metas próximas tiene pensado comprar con los ingresos de las cosecha unas 2 terneritas y luego venderlas para tener otro ingreso.
texts.en: Alberto is from Cosirisne, on the outskirts of the city of Boaco.  He is 60 years old and works in farming.  He sows basic grains that he sells in his community.  Alberto has been working and caring for his mother since he was very young as his siblings live elsewhere.  He pays laborers to support him with his planting and, when the growing season is over, he hires out his fields for cattle which makes him additional income.  Alberto hopes to obtain a good yield from his harvest this year.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and to pay laborers to sow his corn and beans.  This will help him buy the supplies he needs to ensure his harvest will be on time and to make the most of the rain that falls in May.  His future plans are to improve his home where he lives alone with his mom.  His mom is very elderly and needs a lot of care.  His short-term goals are to use the income from his harvest to buy two baby calves which he will later sell to make additional income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay laborers to sow his corn and beans

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: Teresa  habita en la  comarca  llamada Aguas Caliente ubicada en las afueras de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, casada de 44 años de edad tiene tres hijos  de 23 22 y 12 años de edad  respectivamente .Ella empezó  con su negocio  hace 20 años con un préstamo que le daba un familiar quien le cobraba un interés muy alto después trabajo con crédito en una institución que se llamaba     A C J donde fue jefa de grupo solidario de esta manera logro poner su  negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa ambulante la cual lo realiza con el apoyo del marido. Ella necesita este crédito para  invertir en compra de  ropa y surtir  la pulpería ya que se acerca la temporada de clase y es un buen momento para la venta además de la  venta de ropa y pulpería ella quiere  expandir r mas su negocio con venta de oro y plata ya que proporciona buenas ganancia y así podrá mejorar  su casa  también habla que cuando cancele este crédito quiere invertir en la crianza de cerdos reproductores.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in Aguas Caliente, on the outskirts of Teustepe, in the municipality of Boaco.  She is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are 23, 22 and 12 years old.  She started her business 20 years ago with a loan from a family member who charged her a very high rate of interest.  She later worked with loans from an institution called ACJ where she was the leader of her community bank.  In this way, she was able to set up her grocery store and start selling clothing as an itinerant vendor.  She works with the support of her husband.

Teresa needs this loan to invest in buying clothing and to stock her grocery store as the start of the school year is approaching and this is a good time for making sales.  As well as selling clothing and groceries, Teresa would like to further expand her business and start selling gold and silver jewelry as this makes good profits.  This will enable her to improve her home.  She also says that when she has repaid this loan she would like to invest in raising pigs for breeding.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing and to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 22 years old and lives in Airport. She is single and she has two children, ages 7 months and 2 years old, and they live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling bread in her community. She enjoys her business because it keeps her grounded and she likes the exchange of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr is a 26-year-old young farmer. He lives with his mother. Norayr's family has been involved in agriculture for many years, through which they succeeded to build a barn and all the favorable conditions for its further expansion. Now Norayr plans to continue development of the farm himself. He plans to use this loan for purchasing cattle and forage to feed them. He is very optimistic about the farm and its expansion. He hopes to increase his income, which is important for him to start his family and insure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Tirit

texts.en: Tirit is a young farmer from Vayk. He lives with his mother. Tirit works at the local factory as a guard. He also runs a farm, where he currently breeds 2 cows and 5 pigs. To make the farm more profitable and earn more income, Tirit has decided to increase the number of livestock. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase 2 cows. This loan will help Tirit to become more independent financially and insure a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 38 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 10, 6 and 2 years respectively. He has been selling herbal medicine for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of about KES 60,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase packaging materials for the medicine. The profit earned will help him repay his loan. 

His dream is to develop his plot in Eldoret. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase packaging materials for medicine.

loans.name: Sabina Vicenta

texts.es: Sabina es originaria de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, casada, tiene un hijo,  es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, lo inicio hace 12 años  con los ingresos que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior como profesora de primaria y la ayuda de su marido que se dedica a impartir clases en la escuela primaria. Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, vender nuevos producto para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa, uniformes zapatos  y artículos escolares  ya que falta poco tiempo para que inicie la temporada escolar y este es un buen momento para las ventas de este tipo de articulo lo cual le ayudara a atraer a sus cliente y tener  mas ingresos . Una de sus metas  es poder vender  una parte de trigo para la temporada que se ponga escaso y además aumentar la venta de ropa.
texts.en: Sabina is from Teustepe, in the municipality of Boaco.  She is married and has one child.  She sells clothing and has a grocery store where she sells basic grains.  Sabina started her business 12 years ago with the income that she made in her previous job as an elementary school teacher and the help of her husband who teaches classes in an elementary school.  Sabina hopes to expand her business and sell new products so that she can offer her customers a good variety.  She is requesting this loan to buy clothing, uniforms, shoes and school supplies as the new school year is about to start and this is a good time for selling this type of goods.  It will help her to attract customers and make more income.  One of Sabina's goals is to be able to sell some wheat in the season when it is scarce.  She would also like to grow her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, uniforms, shoes and school supplies

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 44 years old. He lives in the village of Sveneti in East Georgia with his family - his wife Mariam, a 20-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old son. His children are students. At the same time, his daughter works in a local bakery as a baker. 

Khvicha and Mariam are leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for the family. In particular, they have 2 hectares of land, where maize, tomatoes, cabbages, as well as apple and cherry trees are grown. They sell their harvested products on the local open market. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns a small pig farm with 5 piglets. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Khvicha requested credit for financing his seasonal agricultural work. He wants to cultivate the land and to purchase fertilizers and onion seeds. He will sow the onions on their family-owned free 0.5 hectare of land. After properly done seasonal work, he can count on a good harvest in the Spring. The family will get more income. Khvicha and Mariam plan to use it for financing the studies of their children.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase onion seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a 35-year-old business lady. She is married to Patrick, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling fish for the past five years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Dorine will use the loan to buy a fridge for storing the fish. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be supplying fish to the nearby hotels and restaurants.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for storing the fish.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 34-year-old business lady and she is married to Peter. They are blessed with four children, aged 13, 11, 7 and 5 years respectively. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with the monthly income of about KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from  KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ann will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 43 years old and married with 3 children. He does dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed 2 people. He also does maize farming to make extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income, and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow and feeds.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and feeds.

loans.name: Alianza Unida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida está formada por 11 socias, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten sacar  adelante a sus familias, se caracterizan por ser mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y mantienen siempre el carisma y la alegría en sus labios. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es la tercera ciudad más  importante del país, ciudad que desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Elsa, tiene 39 años y es madre soltera de  3 hijos de 17, 14 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su último hijo está en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa es propiedad de sus padres.
 
Doña Elsa trabaja en un restaurante, esta actividad  la desempeña hace 20 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo en turnos rotativos. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de los estudios de sus hijos.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The 'Alianza Unida' community bank has 11 members who work in different business activities that allow them to provide for their families.  They are noted for being hard-working, tenacious women who are always charming and cheerful.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is the third largest city in the country and was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  The local people are kind and maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is 39-year-old Elsa who is a single mother and has three children who are 17, 14 and 7.  Her two eldest children are in high school and her youngest is attending a local elementary school.  Elsa does not own her own home but instead lives with her parents in a house that they own.  They share the household expenses.

Elsa has been working in a restaurant for the past 20 years.  She works shifts from Sunday to Sunday.

Elsa has been a member of her community bank for six years and she will invest her new loan in covering her children's educational expenses.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a 44-year-old business lady and the single mother of one child. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past five years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en: Gnel is a 35-year-old farmer. He has been cultivating land for 15 years already. He also works at the local village hall. Gnel has applied for this loan to purchase seeds for the land cultivating in the Spring. He also wants to purchase fertilizer to insure the successful growth of a rich harvest. With the help of this loan, he hopes to get additional income, which he plans to invest in further expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 38 years old, married and the father of two children aged between five and two years old. He has been selling herbal medicine for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan worth 30,000 KES to purchase additional herbal products and to renovate his rental houses. 

The profit earned will help him expand his business. His dream is to lead a better life. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal products and to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married with eight children between the ages of 21 and 35. Her husband is a contractor (builder). She has been involved in business for the past 35 years.

Martha says she has been receiving help from her husband to strengthen her business. Presently she is selling oil and fufu (an African food made of cassava) and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and fufu for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and fufu (an African food made of cassava) for her business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 9 months to 12 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy containers for water storage.

She will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase a water tank. Jackline's business goal is to increase her number of customers within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 27-year-old business lady. She is married to Kennedy, a business man. They are blessed with three children.  She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past five years, with a monthly income of 18,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Ann will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is a 46-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child aged 18 years. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past five years, with a monthly income of 18,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Bancy will use the loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia tiene 46 años, vive en su casa al lado de su pareja y padre de sus 7 hijos: Juan; pero solo vive con 5 de sus hijos ya que los otros 2 son independientes. Su casa es propia y se ubica en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Basilia es una mujer trabajadora, siembra junto a su esposo papa, arveja, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos. Y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, y carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen  de la ciudad. Así también prepara comida en la feria de su distrito. Todos los jueves y domingo traslada sus utensilios y ollas para atender a sus clientes recurrentes. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, especialmente arvejas ya que la demanda se mantiene en cada mes del año. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su préstamo número 10 con MFP, donde promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además está contenta con el trabajo en su banco comunal por la solidaridad de sus miembros. Basilia de recibir su apoyo; comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas y con lo restante comprará 2 sacos de fertilizantes para asegurar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
46-year-old Basilia lives together with her partner, Juan, who is also the father of her seven children.  She currently lives with only five of her children as the other two live independently.  She owns her own home in the small village of Cumutay, in Huasahuasi district.

Basilia is a hard-working woman.  She and her husband grow potatoes, peas, corn and gladioli.  She says that her work requires a lot of commitment.  Every day she patiently tends to her fields until harvest time.  She also cares for her animals (cows, bulls, sheep and pigs).  When it is time to gather her crops, Basilia sees the reward for all her hard work and, together with her family members, she fills heavy sacks with her natural products which she sells to the wholesalers who come from the city.  Basilia also prepares food in the market in her district.  Every Thursday and Sunday she transports her utensils and pans so that she can serve her regular customers.  As she is an entrepreneurial woman, in the future she plans to grow her crops in larger quantities so that she can improve her profits.  She especially intends to grow more peas because they are in demand every month of the year.

Basilia belongs to the 'Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay' community bank and this will be her tenth loan from MFP.  She pledges to be very punctual in making her repayments.  She is happy with the work of her community bank because all the members are supportive.  With your support, Basilia will buy a sack of pea seeds and will use the remainder of her money to buy two sacks of fertilizers to ensure the growth of her crops.

loans.use: to buy one sack of pea seeds and two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Marta Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Marta María, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, vive en la aldea Aguazul de Santa cruz de Yojoa con una nieta de 11 años de edad.

Doña Marta, hace diez años que estableció su propio negocio de venta de medicinas naturales de todo tipo, jabón y champú natural, además le pide al cliente que se realice exámenes antes de recetarle y venderle el medicamento. Ella aprovechó una gran oportunidad de capacitarse en la elaboración de medicinas naturales con un proyecto que llego a la comunidad, de allí logró independizarse con su negocio. Atiende todo el día a sus clientes. Le motivo este negocio porque tiene mucha demanda y porque no depende de nadie, ella obtiene sus propios ingresos para el hogar y estudio de su nieta.
Ha obtenido tres préstamos con ODEF, con los cuales mejoro mucho su negocio, este actual que solicita es de 21,000.00 Lempiras, y lo va invertir en compra de insumos y medicamentos para preparar las medicinas naturales y tener siempre surtido.
Su meta es seguir manteniendo este negocio, hacerlo crecer para obtener los ingresos necesarios del hogar.
texts.en:
Marta María is the single mother of four adult children.  She lives in the village of Aguazul in Santa Cruz, Yojoa.  She has an 11 year old granddaughter.

Ten years ago Marta established her own business of selling natural medicines of all types, soap, and natural shampoo.  Also, she asks to do examinations of the customer before she prescribes and sells them the medicine.  She took advantage of a great opportunity to train in making natural medicines with a project that came to the community.  

From there she managed to become independent with her business.  This business motivates her because there is a big demand, and because she does not depend upon anyone else.  She gets her own income for the household and her granddaughter’s education.

She has had three loans with ODEF, and with them her business improved a lot.  She is currently requesting 21,000 lempiras to buy supplies and medications to prepare natural medicines and to always have stock.  Her goal is to continue maintaining this business, and to make it grow in order to get the income needed for the household.

loans.use: to stock her business with natural medicinal products to sell.

location.town: Aguazul Sierra, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is a 25-year-old married lady. She has two daughters and one son.
 
Haneen works in the daytime at a bank as an office girl. Recently, she started a small business selling detergents at home. Every day she comes back home, feeds her family, does the house chores, and then starts transferring the detergents into smaller quantities or based on her customers orders and makes it ready to sell.

Now Haneen has applied for this loan to buy more bottles and other types of detergents for more than one use.

loans.use: to buy more detergents and bottles.

loans.name: Haleemah

texts.en:
Haleemah is a 44-year-old married lady. Her husband is a sweets maker who works in a sweets shop. They have six sons and daughters.

Haleemah wanted to help her husband in supporting the family, so she started a small retail business at home almost six years ago. She now sells home products, accessories, and blankets.

She has applied for this loan in order to add a new products to sell such as clothes to attract more customers and make more income.

loans.use: to add a new products to sell such as clothes.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take the photo instead.

She is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband, Naeem, is a kids' party planner and organizer. They have five children.

Naeem is a person who loves to bring a smile to people faces, especially kids. So he decided to make that his profession. 

Three years ago Naeem and Iman bought tools and equipment that are used in kids' parties, such as cartoon costumes, face paintings, hand dolls and other items. Since he started his business, he has been successfully working and participating in festivals for kids.

Now Iman has applied for a loan to help her husband and his business by buying DJ equipment.

loans.use: To buy DJ equipment.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 46 años es una mujer soltera de 3 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos, ya que el myo salió de casa para laborar fuera de la ciudad. Habitan en una casa propia en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Juana es una mujer ejemplar, desde que el padre de sus hijos le dejó toda la responsabilidad tuvo que sacar fuerzas de flaqueza para afrontar los problemas, en su mayoría económicos. Hace 20 años que Juana se dedica al trabajo del campo, empezó sembrando papas, arvejas y maíz. En todos estos años aprendió del clima y las enfermedades que atacan sus cultivos, pero como ella es inteligente sabe como enfrentarlos. Así también cria dos asnos y algunos ovinos y porcinos. A pesar de tener varias responsabilidades, disponde de tiempo para mantener limpios su casa, sus parcelas de terrenos, y sus corrales. Está convencida que su trabajo es rentable, pero depende mucho de los cuidados que se le brinden a sus productos y como los comercialice. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este sería su crédito número 10 que obtendría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además manifiesta su agrado de trabajar con su banco comunal por la solidaridad del grupo. Juana invertirá el dinero en la compra de 1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas y con lo restante comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en:
46-year-old Juana is a single mother with three children.  However, she only lives with two of them as her eldest left home to go and work outside the city.  They live in their own home in the small village of Cumutay, in Huasahuasi district.  Juana is an exemplary woman.  When the father of her children left her to bring them up on her own, she had to make a supreme effort to face her problems which were mainly financial.  

Juana has been farming for 20 years.  She started out growing potatoes, peas and corn.  Over all these years, she has learned about the weather and the diseases that can affect her crops.  However, as she is intelligent, she knows how to deal with these problems.  Juana also raises two donkeys and some sheep and pigs.  In spite of all her responsibilities, she still has time to keep her home, her land and her pens clean.  She is certain that her work is profitable but it depends a lot on the care that she takes of her crops and how she sells them.

Juana is a member of the 'Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay' community bank and this will be her tenth loan from MFP thanks to your help.  She pledge to make her monthly repayments on time.  She is grateful that she can work together with her community bank because of the support she receives from the group.  Juana will invest her money in buying one bag of pea seeds.  She will use the remainder to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds and a sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer comes from a conservative family, so she asked her husband, Faheem, to take her place in the photo.

Abeer is a 38-year-old lady who wants to help her husband in supporting the family. Faheem is with the military, but that is not enough to support 10 members as he is the one who takes care of his sisters as well as his wife and kids. 

So Abeer worked with her husband to open a small restaurant for making and selling snacks, fast food and sandwiches. It has been a year now since they started, but now she has applied for a loan to buy new equipment for the restaurant that could help his service to be faster.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for the restaurant.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 54-year-old widowed lady. She was left to support three sons and a daughter. Now the three sons have gotten married and she is now living with her only daughter.

Sabah has been doing a tailoring and sewing business for more than seven years now, and from that she gets to pay for her daily life. 

Now she has applied for this loan to buy another sewing machine as she hopes to open her own workshop and get to employ people to help her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayde is a 47-year-old married woman. Her husband is a blacksmith. They have two sons and a daughter.
 
Ayda is known for her delicious food dishes, so she used that and started making food and sweets to sell. She hopes that one day she can expand and open a big kitchen and employ more women to provide the people with homemade food. 

Now Ayda has applied for a loan to buy new kitchen tools and ingredients for preparing a big order she has.

loans.use: to buy new kitchen tools and ingredients.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 59  años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad el cual esta estudiando, vive con su hijo en la Colonia Victoria, Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Maximina es una señora muy trabajadora, que hace 11 años se gana la vida vendiendo mercadería. Este negocio lo inicio viéndose en la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera  poder darle el sustento diario a su hijo. La mercadería la vende en un puesto del mercado local. Ofreciendo a sus clientes variedad en la  venta de ropa nueva, además vende  piñatas, mesas y comal para hornilla. Ella esta muy contenta porque su negocio le ha dado buenas ganancias de las cuales a reinvertido en el mismo con su buena administración. Dedicándole a su negocio 8 horas diarias.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo de 15, 000 lempiras, para abastecerse de mercadería como ropa nueva.  Espera con esta inversión aumentar su inventario para que sus ingresos sean mejores y así tener una solvencia económica que le permita seguir ayudando a su hijo en el estudio.
Su meta es que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable.
texts.en:
Maximina, age 59, is a single mother.  She has a 12 year old son, and he goes to school.  She lives with her son in the Victoria neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.

Maximina is a very hard-working woman, who for 11 years has been earning a living selling merchandise.  She started this business upon seeing the necessity to get income that would allow her to be able to provide daily sustenance for her son.  

She sells the merchandise from a stand at the local market.  She offers her customers a variety of new clothes.  She also sells piñatas, tables, and griddles for the stove.  She is very happy because her business has given her good income.  She manages it well and reinvests her income in her business.  She devotes eight hours a day to her business. 

She is currently requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras to stock up on merchandise like new clothes.  She hopes to increase her inventory with this investment so that her earnings will be better.  This way she will have financial solvency, which will allow her to continue helping with her son’s education.  Her goal is for her business to always be stable.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 32-year-old married lady. She has four children. Her husband owns a flower shop, and Shireen gives private classes at her home for kids.

She also has a small retail business, selling clothes and recently she added accessories. She makes the accessories herself. That’s why she has applied for a loan. She wants to buy special tools to help her when making the accessories.

loans.use: to buy special tools to help her when making accessories.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative person, so she didn’t want to appear in the photo and asked her brother-in-law, Mohammad, to do so instead.

Iman is a 26-year-old married lady. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Iman has recently started a small retail business selling blankets, but she is almost out of goods so she has applied for a loan in order to buy a bigger quantity and different sizes of blankets to be able to serve more people.

loans.use: to buy a bigger quantity and different sizes of blankets.

loans.name: Sireen

texts.en:
Sireen is a 20-year-old married lady. Her husband is a soldier. They have no children yet.

Sireen has recently started selling blankets. At first, she didn’t buy many, fearing that the business wouldn’t work. But when she found that her neighbors and relatives came to buy from her as soon as they got the news, she decided to widen the business and apply for a loan to buy more quantity of blankets. 

She is also thinking of adding more types of cover sheets that suit other seasons, but she postponed that until the winter is over.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of blankets.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She operates a general store where she sells cereals, plastic and rubber items, and  home products. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a marketplace and her primary customers are walk-ins. 

Ann is requesting a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green grams (mung beans). She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. Ann's  business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to purchase green grams for her cereal shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old, married, and has seven children.  She lives in Buchanan. She sells rice and oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and oil for her business. She hopes to improve her children's education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil.

loans.name: Marla Guadalupe

texts.es:
Marla de 27 años de edad, soltera, vive en  Barrio el centro, Olanchito, Yoro con su familia. 

Ella  es una persona muy conocida, de buenos principios con deseos de superación, hace cinco años ha emprendido un negocio propio con la ayuda de su madre. Vende productos como lociones, carteras, alhajas de plata y otros. Vende de forma ambulante y mediante pedidos que le hacen los clientes. 
Su mayor motivación es obtener sus propios ingresos para pagar los estudios. Al cual le dedica 4 horas diarias.
Está solicitando este préstamo de 20,000.00 Lempiras para invertir más en el negocio, con lociones, carteras y alhajas de plata.

Su meta a corto plazo es seguir con sus estudios universitarios y hacer crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Marla, age 27, is single.  She lives with her family in the El Centro neighborhood in Olanchito, Yoro.  She is a very well-known person with good principles and the desire for self-improvement.  Five years ago she undertook her own business with help from her mother.

She sells products like lotions, wallets, silver jewelry, and others.  She sells in an itinerant manner and through orders that her customers make.  Her biggest motivation is to get her own income in order to pay for her education.  She devotes four hours a day to it.

She is requesting this loan for 20,000 lempiras to invest more in her business with lotions, wallets, and silver jewelry.  Her short term goal is to continue with her university studies and to make her business grow more.

loans.use: to stock her business with products like wallets, lotions, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a conservative woman, so she asked her youngest son, Saleh, to take the photo instead.
 
Basma is a 56-year-old widowed lady. She has two sons and one daughter, who is married now. Her son Saleh, 21 years old, who is appearing in the photo, is a student and security guard in a private company.

Two years ago, after facing a lot of financial trouble, Basma had to think of making a source of income for the family, so she opened a small, basic grocery store. Now, her youngest son is studying and working at the same time, and having the food market was one of the reasons they have survived.  

Therefore, Basma wants to improve the store and add more products so her son will have his own business when he finishes school.

loans.use: to add more products to the store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children aged seven and one year old. She sells used electronic goods, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more electronic goods for sale. The profit earned from her business will help her expand her business. 

She hopes to develop her business and have a better life, and this is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy more electronic goods for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 10 years to 27 years. She describes herself to be a sociable woman. She operates a retail store where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at a strategic area and her primary customers are customers near the market area. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to  buy more shoes and clothes to sell. Rose's business goal is to run another retail boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase a permanent place for a retail store.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith de 42 años convive con Emiterio con quien tiene 4 hijos: Cristian de 19, Jhoel de 16, Emer de 13 y Fiorella de 17 años. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia en la localidad de Pian distrito de Tarma. Judith desde sus 20 años se dedica a la agricultura. Gracias a los conocimientos que sus padres le inculcaron desde niña, puede desempeñarse con destreza en las actividades agrícolas. Es así que ahora siembra zanahorias, cebollas y flores de gladiolos  y otras como: “Sarita” (flores blancas pequeñas). También se encarga de preparas alimentos molidos de granos y cereales como: arvejas, habas, maíz, etc. Hace 3 años año que se dedica a este nuevo negocio y le va muy bien. 
Comenta que para moler sus granos se compró una máquina, con eso agiliza su trabajo. 
Judith dispone su tiempo con tal inteligencia que no descuida sus cultivos, ni su negocio. Y como si fuera poco también administra una pequeña tienda de abarrotes instalada en su propia vivienda. Así puede asegurar a su familia una calidad de vida en la que sus necesidades básicas sean cubiertas con facilidad.
Ahora espera adquirir más terrenos para mejorar su producción de verduras y surtir los productos de venta en su tienda. Éste sería su crédito número 11 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sarita Colonia” y le agrada compartir actividades con personas igual de responsables que ella.
Invertirá el dinero en dos partes iguales: la mitad será para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, con la compra de abarrotes; y la otra mitad será para comprar los granos secos de maíz, arvejas, habas, cebada y trigo para preparar sus alimentos molidos.
texts.en:
42-year-old Judith lives with her partner Emiterio and their four children: 19-year-old Cristian, 16-year-old Jhoel, 13-year-old Emer and 17-year-old Fiorella.  They all live together in their own home in the town of Pian, in Tarma district.

Judith has been farming since she was 20 years old.  Thanks to the knowledge she gained from her parents as a child, she has been able to carry out her farming activities with skill.  She currently grows carrots, onions, gladioli and other flowers such as 'sarita' (small white flowers).  She also grinds grains and cereals such as peas, beans, corn, etc.  She has been in this new business for three years and it is going very well.  Judith comments that in order to grind her grains she bought a machine which makes the work easier.  

Judith manages her time wisely so that she doesn't neglect either her crops or her business.  As if this weren't enough, she also runs a small grocery store which is located in her own home.  This is how she is able to ensure a good quality of life for her family and easily cover their basic needs.  She now hopes to acquire more land so that she can improve her vegetable production and stock her store with goods.

This will be Judith's 11th loan from MFP.  She gives her word that she will make her monthly repayments on time.  Judith is a member of the 'Sarita Colonia' community bank and she enjoys sharing activities with other responsible people like herself.  She will invest her money in two equal sums.  She will use half of her money to stock her store with groceries and the other half to buy dried grains such as corn, peas, beans, barley and wheat for preparing her ground food products.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business and to buy corn, dried beans, dried peas and barley

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with three children in between the ages of 12 and 2 years; two of them go to school. 

Samuel runs a mixed food store business, and he has been in the business for five years. He has one employee. Samuel heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done in the market by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3500 SDG to purchase more items like Nomi, wheat flour, sugar, wool and many others. In addition to this business, Samuel has no other source of income.

In five years' time, Samuel hopes to be building his house. His major challenges include his low income rate and day-to-day change of goods prices. 
 
Samuel says that he is appreciative to Finance Sudan for the support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like Nomi, wheat flour, sugar, wool and many others

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia, esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayuda a invertir en su negocio de ropa.
Esta solicitando un crédito para realizar una mejora a su vivienda, ya que le esta haciendo falta la escalera para subir a los cuartos de la planta alta, actual mente tiene una escalera de madera pero están ya en malas condiciones y le preocupa le pueda pasar un accidente. Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y comprar el material que es cemente, arena, varilla y para pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. Desea construir la escalera de cemento para que sea mas duradera y seguras para su familia.
Doña Aurelia es comercian de venta de ropa y calzado, con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Aurelia is grateful for your cooperation in her previous loan which helped her to invest in her clothing business.

Aurelia is requesting this loan to make an improvement to her home as she lacks a staircase to reach her upstairs rooms.  She currently has wooden stairs but they are in a bad state of repair and she is worried that there might be an accident.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, sand and rods) and to pay the person who will carry out the improvement.

Aurelia would like to build her stairs from cement so that they last longer and are safer for her family.  She has a business selling clothing and footwear.  She plans to use the profits from her business to repay her loan.

loans.use: to build stairs to her upstairs rooms

loans.name: Roseann

texts.en:
Roseann is 43 years old. A business lady, she is married to David a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling potatoes in an open-air market for the  last six years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Roseanne will use the loan to buy sacks of potatoes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a store for selling and storing her potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Edah

texts.en:
Edah is a married woman. She has two children aged 16 and 20 years. She describes herself to be clean and hardworking. Previously, she was employed as a household helper. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs four staff members. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Edah describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of food items. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more food items for preparing meals to sell. Edah's  business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Maria Santos
