Every two weeks, the 'Su Bankito' community bank meet in La California neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is also known as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 56-year-old Maria who is a single mother and has two children from a relationship that she was involved in years ago.  In spite of the fact that they are adults, her children still live with her and are attending university.

Maria learned how to make clothing in an educational center years ago.  She has a sewing workshop and a small store selling household goods in her home.  There, in addition to sewing and selling her own garments, she also sells all kinds of household goods.  She enjoys making women's clothing and children's clothing.  She works every day, from 8.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later when she has to deliver some garment or other.  

Maria has been in this business for more than 15 years and it is how she has provided for her children.  She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and household goods.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes it because of the ease with which she can acquire loans.  Her goals are to make progress in both her business and her personal life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners and household goods

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una es mayor de edad y  otro de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es quien vive con ella.  Su marido es mecánico.
 
Ella es diseñadora de modas ya que estudió en un instituto superior y se graduó de diseñadora en alta costura. Tiene un taller de alta costura en su casa, elabora toda clase de vestidos desde trajes de novias, quinceañeras hasta trajes casuales, a ella le gusta inventar los diseños ya que para eso estudio, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene alguna prenda que entregar, con ella trabajan dos operarias a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual,  tiene dos años  su taller y como le va muy bien está pensando en ampliar el local.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la confección de ropa. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses muy bajos.
 
Su meta es tener el mejor taller de costura de la ciudad.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Su Bankito" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Maria, 45, who is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children.  One of her children is an adult, and the other, who is 17, is studying in school and lives with her.  Her husband is a mechanic.

Maria is a fashion designer; she studied in a technical college and received a degree in high fashion design.  She has a fashion design workshop in her house where she makes all kinds of garments, from bridal dresses to quinceanera dresses to casual suits. She enjoys inventing the designs, because this is what she studied for.  She works each day from 8am until 6pm, and at times she works later when she has some garments to deliver.  She has two employees who work with her whom she pays a monthly salary.  She has had this workshop for 2 years, and since is going very well she is planning to expand her shop.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies for making garments.  She has been with her communal bank for 2 year, and she likes it because she can access loans quickly and at low interest rates.

Maria's goal is to have the best dressmaking shop in the city.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies for making garments

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is 39 years old. She lives with her father and daughter. Hasmik has been engaged in agriculture for 10 years already. She also works at the local school. Hasmik has applied for this loan to start cultivating land, for which she needs to purchase seeds. Hasmik hopes to gather a rich harvest and get additional income from its sale, which means improved living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 27-year-old business lady. She is married to Thomas, a business man. They are blessed with two children, who are 9 and 4 years old. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 18,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Priscilla will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – замужем. У нее двое дочерей. Елена занимается мелким предпринимательством, торгуя искусственными цветами и мелким промышленным товаром на одном из местных рынков своего родного города Мелитополя. В торговле Елена работает уже 15 лет. На данный момент у нее в товаре 30 000 гривен, ее прибыль составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Елена обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить искусственные цветы и пополнить  ассортимент товара перед праздниками. Удачно реализовав свой товар, Елена сможет на дополнительную прибыль расширить свой бизнес и развивать его и далее. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Yelena is married and has two daughters.  She is involved in a small entrepreneurship and sells artificial flowers and small household goods at one of the local markets in her native city of Melitopol.  Yelena has been in sales for 15 years.  Currently, she has 30,000 hryvnia in merchandise, and her profit is about 5,000 hryvnia.  Yelena requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia from Kiva to buy artificial flowers and refill merchandise selection before the holidays.  After selling the merchandise successfully, Yelena would be able to use the additional profit to expand her business and develop it further.

loans.use: to buy artificial flowers and refill merchandise selection before the holidays

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es: Juaquina, de 70 años, es una mujer sencilla y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Edmundo de 69 años y su hija Haydee de 29 años, a quien brindar una buena estadía. Juaquina, es de edad muy avanzada, pero aún así ella trabaja sin descansar por ofrecer una mejor calidad para su hija; ella tiene una carpintería en la que su esposo se dedica a laborar; Edmundo, su esposo, fabrica todo lo que son muebles, mesas, sillas, etc.; y Juaquina solo se dedica a  ofrecer sus muebles y venderlas; aunque hay personas que especialmente mandan a hacer sus propios diseños. Su mayor anhelo es poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble, ya que antes era de madera. Ella desde que inicio a solicitar los préstamos de MFP cuenta que siempre le ha ido muy bien de manera que así llego a obtener su carpintería. Este será su crédito número 17 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que una vez más contará con el apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su objetivo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal ya que siempre trabajó con personas responsables y solidarias. Con el crédito solicitado terminará de construir su casa; por eso comprará cemento y fierros; para tener tranquilidad junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juaquina, aged 70, is a simple and go-getting woman. She lives in their own house with her husband Edmundo, aged 69, and their daughter Haydee, aged 29, to whom she provides a good home. Juaquina is an elderly person, yet she works tirelessly to offer a better quality of life to her daughter. She has a carpentry store where her husband Edmundo works: he makes furniture, tables, chairs, etc.; Juaquina sells the furniture in her store. Sometimes there are people who have their furniture specifically made according to their own design.

Juaquina's greatest desire is to finish the construction of the family home with noble building materials, because now it is made of wood. Since the beginning of her credit history with loans from the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma, she did very well and has managed to fully equip their carpentry store. This will be her 17th loan with the institution and she is very happy that she can rely once more on its financial support, because she feels that she can safely pursue her goals with it. In addition, she likes to be a member of her communal bank, where she has always worked with responsible and supportive people. Juaquina will use her loan to finish the construction of her home; she will buy cement and metal sheets, and ultimately enjoy peace and quiet with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and metal sheets to finish the construction of the family home.

loans.name: Katty Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Katty, tiene 29 años, es casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, el mayor este año empieza sus estudios escolares. Su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajería.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos de su familia decidió dedicarse primero a la venta de zapatos y en la actualidad a más de zapatos también vende sabanas, ropa de todo tipo y realiza trabajos de belleza a domicilio.  Su forma de  venta es  puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas diarias, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, sus mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva más de cinco años en este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, sabanas, zapatos y productos de belleza  para sus trabajos. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos complementarios que ofrece la institución. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Su Bankito" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Katty, 29, who is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 2. Her oldest started school this year.  Her husband has a locksmith shop.

Katty is a housewife who, in order to help out with the household expenses, decided to start selling shoes.  Now, in addition to shoes, she also sells bed sheets and all types of clothing, and she also provides beauty services in her home. She sells door-to-door and works every day for 2 to 3 hours.  She sells her products on credit and collects every 8 days.  When she needs more products she goes to Guayaquil to buy them.  She has been working in this business for 5 year and it is going quite well.

She will use this loan to buy clothing, sheets, shoes and beauty products for her business.  She has been with her communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because of the sequential loans and other benefits that the institution offers.

Her dream is to continue to make progress with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bed sheets, shoes and beauty products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 22 years old and single, and supports his two brothers in school. He owns a shop, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 26,000. He has requested a loan worth KES 20,000 which he will use to purchase four bags of sugar, three bundles of unga (flour) and two cartons of cooking fat. 

The profit he makes from his business helps him pay school fees. He also hopes to buy a plot and develop it. This is his first loan. His dream is to own a business empire and his own home.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of unga (flour), two boxes of cooking fat and four bags of rice.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 36-year-old business lady. She is married to Thomas, a business man. They are blessed with two children, ages 14 and 11. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 14 years and earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Agnes will use the loan to buy more clothes for resale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 43-year-old, married woman with three children.

For the last 15 years, she has been in the hospitality business in Nakuru town. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers. This would be her first loan. She plans to use the loan proceeds to buy more chairs and tables for her cafeteria.

In future, Margaret hopes to expand her business and open another cafe in the neighboring town.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Shavkatjon

texts.ru: Шавкатчон честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 4 года он занимается предоставлением услуг такси на собственной автомашине. Он ездит по городскому маршруту. Этим бизнесом он зарабатывает и кормит свою семью. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для ремонта своего автомобиля с целью высококачественного обслуживания своих клиентов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shavkatjon is an honest and hardworking person.  He is married and raising three children.  He has been involved in providing a taxi service with his own car for over four years.  Shavkatjon provides transportation along a city route.  He earns a living with this business and supports his family.  Shavkatjon wants to obtain a loan in the amount of $2000 to repair his car in order to provide a high-quality service for his customers.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 27-year-old, single man.

For the past 10 years, he has worked as a bread distributor. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its clients. This would be his first loan, which he would use to purchase additional stocks of bread for distribution.

In future he hopes to own a bakery.

loans.use: To purchase additional bread

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 26-year-old, married woman living in Buchanan. She and her husband have two children (ages 2 and 5).

For the past four years, she has been selling palm oil in the market. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.

In the near future, she hopes to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase additional palm oil for her business

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is a young farmer from Karakert village. He lives with his wife and little child.

The main income for his young family comes from agriculture: cattle breeding and land cultivating. Gor faces challenges connected with feeding the cattle until the summer months. Thus, he has applied for this loan to purchase the necessary provisions. Specifically, the loan proceeds would allow Gor to keep the farm stable and would create the necessary conditions to develop it in the future.

Gor wants to ensure a prosperous life for his wife and child, and the development of his agriculture business is vital for him to implement this goal.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for his agriculture business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena de 36 años casada y tiene una hija, se dedica a la venta de consumó diario como frijol, azúcar, maíz, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos etc. Tiene su negocio hace 17 años antes de casarse fue el patrimonio que le heredaron sus padres, en su domicilio también tiene crianza de pollos  necesita nuevamente refinanciar su crédito ya que necesita seguir surtiendo su tienda o ya sea poner otra sucursal donde vive con su esposo. Su sueño y meta es seguir apoyado a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la estabilidad económica como también seguir dándole lo necesario a su hija que ya estudia.esta solicitando este credito para la compra productos de consumo Diario.
texts.en: Maria Elena is 36 years old and married with one daughter. She works selling basic grocery products such as beans, sugar, corn, snacks, soft drinks, juices, etc. She started with her business 17 years ago, before she was married; she inherited it as a legacy from her parents. She also raises chickens at her home. She needs to refinance her loan again because she needs to continue to stock her store, or to set up another branch where she lives with her husband. Her dream and goal is to continue supporting her husband with the household expenses and achieve economic stability, as well as to give her daughter, who is already studying, all that she needs. She is requesting this loan to buy basic grocery products.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products.

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es: Brenda Aracely de 26 años casada  y madre de Justin de 5 años de edad, Brenda  actualmente trabaja como maestra de educación primaria de media jornada, y al bordado  de blusas, cortes delantales, Brenda se dedica al bordado a máquina desde hace 9 años, con el cual ha podido ayudar en el cuidado de su niño,y como el sustento de su hogar, ella ha logrado apoyar a su esposo a culminar sus estudios como maestro de educación primaria, quien en este año a Dios  gracias logro concluir con satisfacción su carrera profesional, doña Brenda manifiesta que gracias al apoyo obtenido a través del préstamo y a su entusiasmo por trabajo se siente satisfecha como mujer, madre y  también en la formación de sus alumnos, su deseo es  ahora seguir trabajando junto a su esposo y realizar mejoría en su hogar  que ahora son su prioridad.es poe eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para sequir con su negocio que es el bordado.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely is 26 years old and married. She is the mother of Justin, age 5. Brenda currently works as a primary school teacher for half days, and she also works embroidering blouses, skirts and aprons. Brenda has worked in machine embroidery for 9 years. With this work she has been able to help care for her son, and as the source of support for her household, she has been able to help her husband to finish his studies as a primary school teacher. This year, "thanks to God," he was able to complete his professional degree with satisfaction. Brenda reports that thanks to the support obtained through the loan, and to her enthusiasm for working, she feels satisfied as a woman, as a mother, and also in the education of her students. Her desire now is to continue working, together with her husband, and to make improvements to her home, which are her priorities now. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy supplies in order to continue with her embroidery business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidering.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 59 years old, married to Richard, and blessed with five children aged 30, 29, 27, 17, and 13 years old respectively. She has sold assorted metals for the last 19 years. She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase more metal materials to sell.

The anticipated profit will help her buy a plot on which to settle her family in future. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en:
Murvat is a 31-year-old man living in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two daughters.

He is farmer. For the last three years, he has grown and harvested seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he sells in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is approximately 340 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

Murvat joined AqroInvest to gain access to financial services to thereby improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN through AqroInvest and Kiva to purchase additional vegetables to sell in his business. With the anticipated profits generated from the business as a result of the loan, he would like to educate his daughters. In the future, Murvat dreams of opening a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en: Ofeliya is 33 years old, married and raising two sons, the youngest of whom is six years old. She lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her sons and husband. Her husband actively helps her in a business breeding animals, which they decided to start after removal to an IDP settlement. Currently Ofeliya is applying for her second loan from AqroInvest, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Ofeliya will use the loan to buy two dairy cows and mineral fertilizers. She plans to invest any revenue in further increasing her livestock.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram is a 25-year-old trader from Yerevan. He rents a booth at the city market, where he sells clothing. Due to his personal qualities, he has been successfully running the business by offering a large variety of clothing for customers of different ages. Aram has applied for this loan to purchase more clothing for the coming spring and summer seasons. This will allow him to increase sales and earn more income. With additional income Aram will grow his business further and ensure financial stability for his family. Aram lives with his parents and sister, who is a student.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Handful

texts.en: A resident of  Buchanan, Handful is a 33-year-old single mother of two children aged 13 and 15, both of whom attend school. For the past two years Handful has been operating a tailoring shop where she sews and sells clothes; she is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business, and hopes to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Duo Bendicion De Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
DUO BENDICION DE LAS LOMAS
Este dúo está formado por doña María Nazaria de 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña tienda de consumo diario desde hace 3 años, en su casa y está solicitando este crédito para poder agrandar su negocio e invertir en productos comestibles de consumo diario porque a beses allegan sus clientes y le piden productos que aun no tiene a la venta.agradese a kiva por ayudarla a superarse,  También esta Ángela Isamar, de 20 años de edad es soltera y se dedica a la costura de cortes y güipiles típicos, y luego los vende en antigua Guatemala, nos cuenta que necesita el crédito para poder comprar cortes y hacerles costura porque ahora le están pidiendo más mercadería pero la ropa típica es muy cara y ella no tiene el capital suficiente para invertir además, tiene ahora una hermana que le está ayudando a hacer las costuras pero material no tiene para poder agrandar su negocio por eso necesita el apoyo para poder vender mas ya que le piden tambien en otras comunidades y ella tiene que pedir más tiempo porque no tiene suficiente material espera  y confía que se le pueda apoyar que quiere apoyar a su familia con su trabajo ahora que le va bien.
texts.en:
DUO BENDICION DE LAS LOMAS

One member of the duo is María Nazaria, who is 31 years old, married and has three children. She tells us that she has managed a small general store for the past three years, set up in her house. She is requesting a loan in order to extend her business and invest in staple food products, as sometimes her customers come and ask for products which she does not have for saleat the moment. She is grateful to Kiva for this help in excelling.

Also in the duo is Ángela Isamar, who is 20 years old and is single. She makes a living cutting and sewing typical blouses (güipiles) to later sell in old Guatemala. She tells us that she needs a loan to be able to buy cuts of fabrics to sew as she is being asked for more stock but typical clothing is very expensive and she does not have enough capital to invest. Also, she has a sister who helps her sewing but she doe not have material in order to be able to extend her business. For this reason she needs the support to be able to sell more, as people from other communities also order from her. She has to ask for more time as she does not have enough material. She hopes and wishes that she can receive help as she wants to support her family with her work, now that it is going well.

loans.use: to buy staple everyday food products.

loans.name: Acela

texts.es: Acela, de 35 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, está casada con Juan de 40 años y tiene seis hijos de 17, 15, 11, 7, 2 años y el menor de 1 mes de nacido. Vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Acela consiste en dos actividades, el primero es de administrar un taller de mecánica en el cual trabajan tres personas incluyendo a su esposo quien es el que dirige la parte de reparaciones del taller, el segundo es de venta de repuestos en el cual ella atiende, su taller y su venta están en su propia casa en donde condiciono un lugar para poder atender a sus clientes. Lleva realizando éste trabajo desde hace 1 año, pero anteriormente estuvo en otro local por cuatro años. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le permite el tiempo de estar a lado de sus hijos, ya que lo realiza en su casa y puede verlos todo el día, además tiene buenas ventas y con esto logra buenas ganancias. Está muy entusiasmada de seguir trabajando ya que desea ampliar su taller y ofrecer otros servicios adicionales al que tiene, pero para eso necesita una inversión mas y así poder comprar nuevos equipos de trabajo. Este será el crédito numero 18 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado está convencida de poder cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores cerditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son muy responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará herramientas para implementar su taller, además de repuestos para continuar con su venta ya que implementará con nuevos accesorios y piezas de nuevas marcas.
texts.en:
Acela, 35, is a kind, good, very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Juan, 40, and they have six children who are 17, 15, 11, 7 and 2 years old and the youngest who is a month old.  She lives in her own house and works hard to provide her family with a better quality of life.  

Acela’s work consists of two activities.  The first is running a machine shop where three employees, including her husband, work; her husband directs the repairs part of the shop.  The second is selling spare parts which is what she does.  Her shop and her sales take place at home where she set up space to tend to customers.  She’s been in this work for a year but she used to have another shop for four years.  She enjoys her work because it leaves her with time to be by her children since she works at home and can watch over them all day; besides, she has good sales and earns good profits.  She is very enthusiastic about continuing to work and because she wants to expand the shop and offer other services in addition to those she has now but to do so she needs to invest more to buy new equipment for work.

This will be MFP loan #18.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel surer of advancing with her work this way.  On the other hand, she’s convinced that she’ll be able to make her payments like she’s done with previous loans she’s had.  Besides, she likes to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 3500 soles to buy tools to equip her shop as well as spare parts to stock her sales with new accessories and items from new brands.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has been in the cereals and potato business in Nakuru town, Kenya, for the last three years. He is 26 years old and married to Teresiah, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness event and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cereals and potatoes to sell in his business.

In future, Victor hopes to expand his business and supply potatoes and cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-30s, is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The operator of a beauty salon since 2000, she is able to make a fair monthly profit working from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily.

Now requesting her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to purchase more salon equipment, Asha used her previous loans, all since repaid, to restock items in her salon and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Safina," which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more salon equipment.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 63 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en casa propia junto a uno de sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, está separada de su esposo y durante todo este tiempo ha luchado sola, hizo lo posible para salir adelante junto a sus hijos quienes son profesionales y le ayudan. Beatriz se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, se va a otras ciudades en busca de vender a sus caseros y clientes fijos que viven en otras ciudades y viaja muy a menudo llevando el pescado seco de la región. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado de buena calidad y además tiene una manera muy amable de ser con sus clientes ya que siempre les brinda una sonrrisa. Hace seis meses inicio un nuevo proyecto, el cual es de venta de abarrotes y con el cual desea tener buenos ingresos y dejar de viajar a otros lugares ya que le es un poco cansado y en algunas ocasiones peligroso.
Le gusta de su trabajo, pues puede conversar con sus clientes y bromear entre ellos, lleva muchos años en éste negocio y del que aprendió día a día de como tener mejores ingresos y lograr una ganancia al máximo y aunque es un poco riesgoso lo hace por el bien de su economía y para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará pescado para ir a vender a otros lugares, pero ésta vez serán de diferentes especies y tamaños ya que le piden variedad, asimismo invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes implementándolo con gaseosas y productos que necesita.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 63, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with one of her two children who are now adults.  She’s separated from her husband and during all this time she’s struggled alone.  She did whatever was possible to get ahead with her children who are now professionals and help her out.  

Beatriz is a fish merchant.  She goes to other cities to sell to households and to regular customers that live in other cities.  She travels often taking dry regional fish.  She has many customers since she sells good quality fish and she also has a very kind way of treating her customers always with a smile for them.  Six months ago she started a new project which is selling groceries and she hopes to earn good income from it and be able to stop traveling to other places since it’s a bit tiring and sometimes somewhat dangerous.

What she likes about her work is being able to chat and joke around with her customers.  She’s been in business for many years and she learned day to day how to earn better income and maximum profits.  Although it’s a bit risky she does it for the good of her economy and to have a better quality of life.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She’s happy to know that she’ll have financial support since she’ll feel surer of making progress with her work.  Besides, she commits once more to make her payments like she’s done in previous loans.  She’s happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 1500 soles to buy fish to go to sell in other places but this time it will be different species and sizes since she’s being asked for variety.  She will also invest in her grocery store stocking it with soft-drinks and products she needs.

loans.use: to buy fish to stock her store.

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira is a 47-year-old married woman and is a mother of three wonderful children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). This is someone who has been forced to leave their home suddenly as a result of armed conflict. She has been cultivating crops and doing animal husbandry for twelve years to support her family. 

Zemfira wants to improve her living conditions and create comfort for her children. Because of the financial means shortage, she requested this loan in the amount of 1000 AZN to purchase four head of cattle. She will use the remaining sum to buy livestock feed. This is her first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase four head of cattle

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir is 52 years old and a married man who lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement with his wife, two sons and daughter. His wife helps out with the household. Bakir is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock. His sons helps him with this business.

 Bakir has several head of small livestock. He fattens livestock for several months and then sells them at a market at higher prices. He requested a loan in the sum of 500 AZN to buy livestock. This is his first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. Bakir counts on your help and is grateful to you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Salvadora Nohemi

texts.es: Salvadora es de Teustepe municipio de Boaco tiene 37 años de edad,  casada, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno esta en la escuela secundaria.  Inicio se negocio de pulpería hace 8 años con dinero propio, es de oficio comerciante; también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de frijol producto  que lo vende  en la ciudad de Managua  con la ayuda de su marido  lo cual le permite tener  otro ingreso. Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de  granos básicos como arroz, frijol, maíz, aceite, trigo para vender.  En sus planes futuros piensa comprar un pedazo de tierra con la ganancia que obtenga de la cosecha de frijol, una de sus metas son poner otro puesto de venta de granos básicos que ella misma siembra para tener más ingreso y brindarle un mejor servicio a las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Salvadora is from Teustepe, Boaco Municipality; she’s 37 years old, married and has two children one of which is in secondary school.  She started her grocery store 8 years ago with her own money; she’s a merchant.  She also farms beans which she sells in the city of Managua with help from her husband which means an additional source of income.

She requested the loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, corn, oil and wheat to sell.  Her future plans include buying a piece of land with profits from her bean sales.  One of her goals is to set up another basic grain sales stand to sell what she grows herself and provide better service to people in her community.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice, beans, corn, oil and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es:
Catherine, de 32 años, es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante en la vida, es madre soltera de dos hijos, eso no le quita la alegría y las ganas de superarse, vive en la casa de su madre y espera pronto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos. Para Catherine el negocio de la venta de comida es una actividad que le ayuda a poder tener sus ingresos para dar una buena educación a sus hijos, ella realiza ésta actividad en la casa de su madre. Lleva ya más de dos años en éste negocio, se siente cómoda trabajando ahí tiene tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades además de estar a lado de sus hijos. lo que no le gusta es que a veces tiene que dar crédito a algunos comensales y le hacen esperar para su pago, pero siempre con buen animo terminan pagándole. Su negocio esta cerca de una empresa grande de la ciudad por lo que tiene gran cantidad de clientes y por lo mismo muy buenos ingresos diarios. Se siente muy a gusto con lo que hace y espera seguir así, ya que le permite tener la tranquilidad que necesita para su familia, ahora se prepara a ampliar su negocio con más sillas y mesas para dar más comodidad sus clientes. Este será el crédito numero 2 con MFP, por ello está muy contenta ya que tendrá un apoyo financiero y así podrá seguir avanzando con su negocio. Además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, por otro lado menciona estar muy contenta de trabajar junto a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios y son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes, e insumos para continuar con su negocio, además de sillas, mesas y utensilios para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Catherine, 32, is a cheerful, hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead in life.  She’s a single mother of two children but this does not detract from her joy or her desire to improve.  She lives in her mother’s house and she hopes to soon improve her and her children’s quality of life.

For Catherine the business selling food is an activity that helps her earn income to provide her children with a good education.  She carries out this activity in her mother’s house.  She’s been in business over two years now and feels comfortable working there because she has time to do other things while being alongside her children.  What she doesn’t like is that sometimes she has to extend credit to some of her diners and they make her wait for her payment but eventually they all end up paying her in good spirits.

Her business is near a large firm in the city so she has a good number of customers which means good daily income.  She feels very comfortable with what she does and hopes to continue this way since it provides her with the tranquility she needs for her family.  She’s now preparing to enlarge her business with more tables and chairs to provide more customer comfort.

This will be her MFP loan #2 and she’s very happy because she’ll have financial support to continue advancing with her business.  She commits once more to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  On the other hand she mentions that she’s very happy working alongside her communal bank members because they are all very responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 1500 soles to buy ingredients and supplies to continue with her business in addition to tables, chairs and utensils to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients as well as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 36 years old. She lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement in Bilasuvar with her husband, his school-aged sons and daughter. Gulnara takes care of a milk cow, owned by the family. She makes cheese and sells it in the village and in the local bazaar. Currently the total average monthly income of the family is 260 AZN. 

Gulnara requested a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN for purchasing three calves. She will raise them for 5-6 months and sell the grown calves in the summer for a higher price. This will give additional income to the family, which Gulnara plans to use for purchasing needed household goods, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Tapdiq

texts.en:
Tapdiq is a 55-year-old man who lives with his family in a settlement for IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) in Bilasuvar. 

This loan is his first with the AqroInvest and Kiva. Tapdiq used this loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN to buy large quantities of various products such as soft drinks and cookies to supply his business. In this way, he will increase his capital. Tapdiq is going to use the profits for buying merchandise.

He dreams about expanding his business and is very happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of various products.

loans.name: Abiyunze/ Pr Bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Wellars fait partie du groupe Abiyunze /PR BGRM. Il a 60 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 18 mois à 29 ans, dont 5 enfants scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Wellars est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Wellars voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Wellars is part of the Abiyunze /PR BGRM group. He is 60 years old. He is married with 5 children from 18 months to 29 years old, of whom 5 children go to school. His level of education is 6 years of primary school.

Wellars is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy to grow his business is to use select chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, Wellars would like to be a great rice farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Abajyamigambi /kmg Group

texts.fr:
Anastase fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi/Kmg. Il a 32 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1 an. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Anastase est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Anastase voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner  ses enfants.
texts.en:
Anastase is part of the Abajyamugambi/Kmg group. He is 32 years old. He is married with 1 child who is 1 year old. His level of education is 6 years of primary school.

Anastase is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers.

His strategy to grow his business is to use select chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, Anastase would like to be a great rice farmer in his region. With the profits, he plans to pay for his child's schooling and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia  o Doña cheva  como es conocida en su pequeña comunidad  llamada El Cacao localizada en las afueras del departamento de Boaco, tiene 70 años de edad, nos  cuenta que tuvo 10 hijo los cuales ya están casados  y viven en la capital. Ella dice que sus actividades en  la agricultura  comenzaron a los 19 años de edad  cuando se caso, al fallecer su esposo. Ella comenzó hacerse cargo por completo de la finca y la crianza de sus hijos. 
Los granos que  cosecha  los vende  en su misma comunidad además vende sus cuajadas  que ella misma elabora con leche  de sus vacas aunque recibe ayuda de sus hijos para el mantenimiento de la finca hace falta un poco mas de inversión para mantener la finca en condiciones optimas. Hoy necesita el crédito para comprarle alimento al ganado que posee  y para  sembrar  maíz y frijol. Su meta es comprar dos vacas mas sacar buena producción de leche y ampliar las área de siembra de granos básicos que es de mucha necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia, or Doña Cheva, like she’s known in her small community of El Cacao located in the outskirts of Boaco Department, is 70 years old.  She tells us that she had 10 children who are already married and live in the capital.  She says that her farming activities started when she was 19 years old when she got married and when her husband passed away she took over taking care of the farm and raising her children.

The grains she grows she sells in her own community and she also sells cheese that she, herself, makes with milk from her cows.  Even though she gets help from her children for farm maintenance she still needs a bit more investment to keep the farm in optimal conditions.  Today, she needs the loan to buy feed for the cattle she has and to plant corn and beans.  Her goal is to buy two more cows to improve milk production and to expand the area she has planted with basic grains which are of great need in her community.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab is 50 years old and married with four children. As a source of income for her family, Zeynab works in animal husbandry and farming. Starting with the purchase of a cow, Zeynab has been able to develop her farm which numbers, at present, two milk cows, two calves and 20 sheep. 

In order to further develop her business, she has requested a loan in the sum of 1500 AZN from Aqroinvest and Kiva to buy 3 heads of livestock. This is her third loan. Zeynab plans to invest the earnings into increasing her headcount of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy 3 heads of livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for three and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a loan for 4,748 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, de 61 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, está separa hace 12 años del que fue su esposo por mucho, ella es madre de tres hijos quienes son mayores e independientes, ahora solo trabaja para ella y su nieta de 13 años a quien educa y cría pues desea hacerla un elemento bueno para la sociedad. Durante los días de la semana, Erlinda se dedica a la costura de prendas de diversos diseños, además de algunas fundas para almohadas, muebles y juegos completos de dormitorio. Tiene su pequeño taller que acondiciono en un lugar estratégico de su casa en el realiza todo su trabajo. Lleva con éste negocio hace mucho tiempo, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijas o de su nieta, pues ella sale a ofrecer los fines de semana a amigos, vecinos y familiares o a cualquier cliente que desee tener una juego de dormitorio de buena calidad y a muy buen precio. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite tener tiempo para ver a sus animalitos y a sus plantas ya que uno de sus pasatiempos favoritos es el de la agricultura, tiene muchos planes a futuro ya que desea seguir creciendo y haciendo prosperar a su negocio, y aun que en los últimos meses tuvo mucho problemas como el robo que sufrió de su mototaxi que alquila, ella no mira hacia atrás y siempre está avanzando para mejorar su situación. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila, ella por su parte está comprometida en seguir siendo una socia puntual en sus cuotas así como fue en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 4000 soles, comprará materiales para seguir haciendo su trabajo y empezar a aumentar su producción, además formalizara los documentos de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and an outstanding, friendly, and hardworking woman. She and her husband separated 12 years ago. Erlinda is the mother of three grown children who are independent. Now she only works for herself and her 13-year-old granddaughter who she is raising and providing an education. Erlinda wants her to be a good influence on society. During the week, Erlinda works as a seamstress, making garments of different designs. In addition, she produces a few pillowcases, furniture covers, and bedroom sets. She has a small space that is equipped and located in a strategic area of her house where she does all of her work. Erlinda has been in this business for a long time. Occasionally she receives help from her daughters or her granddaughter. She sells what she produces on the weekends to friends, neighbors, and other customers looking to buy a high-quality bedding set at a good price. Erlinda enjoys her work because it allows her time to take care of her animals and crops since farming is one of her favorite hobbies. She has many plans for the future and wants to continue growing her business to make it prosper. In the past few months, she has encountered many problems. For example, the motorcycle taxi that she rents out was robbed. She refuses to look back and is always moving forward to improve her situation.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP. Erlinda is very pleased to know that she will have financial support, which will guarantee that she can continue working peacefully. In return, she promises to be a member who is punctual with her payments, just as she was with her previous loans. She is also very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank since all of the members are responsible and supportive individuals. The amount of 4000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy materials so that she can continue her work and increase her production. In addition, she will finalize the documents for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and to finalize the purchase of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 56-year-old, married woman residing in Sebac, Sapang Dalaga, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Regina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 2,000.00 PHP doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of 4,421.00 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Regina wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 32 years old, married and has one child.  She is from Sepac Sapang, Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Jelyn owns and operates a retail store selling home use products. Jelyn has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Jelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelyn is requesting a loan for 5,888 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya a été créé le 20 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de 20 membres qui habitent la même zone.
Il ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fily (debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo levant le bras) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55, elle a 7 enfants. son activité principale est la vente de bouillie de mil et de maïs et du lait caillé. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années.   

Elle compte investir son prêt pour l'achat du mil, du maïs qu'elle transforme en bouillie destinée à la vente. Elle achète du lait en poudre qu'elle transforme en lait caillé.

A travers ce prêt, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne, la scolarité de ses enfants, et les frais médicaux.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group was created on December 20, 2009. It consists of 20 members who live in the same zone. Their primary business is shopkeeping.

Madam Fily (standing on the extreme right in the photo and raising her arm) is responsible for the group. She is 55 years old, and she has 7 children. Her primary business is selling mil [African cereal] and corn gruel and curdled milk. She has been managing this business for several years.

She plans to invest her loan to buy mil and corn which she transforms into gruel to resell. She buys powdered milk that she transforms into curdled milk.

With this loan, she plans to take care of daily expenses, her children's schooling, and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy mil [African cereal] and corn to make gruel and to buy powdered milk to make curdled milk.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 49-year-old businesswoman from Yerevan. She is a head of the family of nine: Aida, her pensioner husband, two sons, two daughters-in-law, and three grandchildren. As a hardworking woman with initiative, Aida has started her business of selling clothing to have stable source of income and support her sons' young families. Aida would like to increase the variety of clothing for the coming spring and summer seasons to meet the clients' demand. For this reason she has applied for a loan to purchase the necessary clothing. This will help Aida to increase sales and get more income, which is important for her to sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica   is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between 7months old to 9 years old. Three  of them are attending school and all of them live at home. For the past few years, Monica has been selling  dried fish  in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  dried fish for her business. She plans to educates her children and take good care of them.

loans.use: to purchase more  dried fish for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 36 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between the ages of 15 and 20. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling rice, peppers, bitter ball (melon), and oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, bitter ball, pepper, and oil for her business. Her plan is to send her children to a high quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, bitter ball, pepper, and oil for her business

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 36 years old and lives in Airport.  She is married and her husband is a Firestone worker. They have five children who are all in school and live at home.  

For the past two years, Taway has been selling oil, pepper, rice, and vita.  She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, pepper, rice, and vita for her business.  She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. Her plans are to build a house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pepper, rice, and vita for her business.

loans.name: Hellena

texts.en:
Hellena lives in Airport. She stopped her education in 4th grade.  She is single and has two children, ages 2 and 10 years old. One of her children is in school and both live at home.

For the past ten years, Hellena has been selling palm oil.  One problem she is facing is that, she has little income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  palm oil for her business. Her future plans are to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 47 años, es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de vivir, comparte su vida con su pareja viviendo en su casa que pudo comprar junto a el, además vive con sus tres hijos a quienes brinda buena educación y son su razón de esfuerzo y a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

Desde muy temprano María inicia su trabajo cuando sale en busca de las frutas mas frescas y agradables de la región, ella se dirige al mercado de frutas ubicado por el centro de la ciudad en donde va en busca de sus proveedores quienes le dan la mejor calidad, después vuelve a su casa pues los clientes están en espera para los desayunos de los niños que van al colegio, ésta actividad realiza en su casa y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos además que su esposo trabaja como transportista y juntos generan buenos ingresos a su hogar. Durante el tiempo que realiza su trabajo, aprendió que no se puede dar por perdido nada y las frutas que están a punto de malograrse por estar muy maduros, los hace en helados y mermelada.
Le gusta de su trabajo pues integra a su familia ya que tiene la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo, además de poder realizar ésta actividad por las mañana y tener libre por las tardes, espera agrandar su negocio pues tiene todas las ganas y el deseo de poder superar sus mismas expectativas. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mas frutas para su negocio ya que se aproxima la etapa escolar y desea tener contentos a sus clientes, además de comprar plátano ya que su precio está empezando a subir y desea tenerlos en cantidad para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and is a happy woman who loves life. She shares her life with her partner, living together in the home that they bought together. They also live with their 3 children who are her reason for everything she does. She provides her children with a good standard of education and hopes to provide them with a better standard of living.

María starts work early in the morning when she goes out in search of the region's freshest and best fruits. She heads to the fruit market located in the city centre where she tracks down her suppliers, who always give her their best quality produce. Later, she returns to her home where her clients are waiting to buy from her so that they can give their school-aged children their breakfasts. She works from her own home and her children help her out; her husband works as a transport driver and together they bring a decent wage into the home.
In all the time that she has been working in this role, she has learned that nothing can be wasted and she makes ice-cream and jams out of the fruits that are too ripe and close to spoiling. She likes her work as it involves her family, who help her out, and after working at her business in the mornings, she has the afternoons free. She hopes to grow her business as she has every wish and desire to exceed her own expectations.
This will be her second loan with MFP, as such she is counting on their collaboration in order to continue working towards her aims. On the other hand, she is also committed once again to fulfilling the repayment schedule just as she did with her previous loan. She is very happy about being a member of her communal bank as the people involved are good, pleasant and very supportive. With the requested loan amount of 1500 NS, she will buy more fruit for her business as the start of the school year is close at hand and she wants to satisfy her clients, as well as buying bananas because the price is starting to rise and she wants to buy a larger quantity to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy a greater range of fruits.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home use products. 

Myrna has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,748 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela, de 48 años, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, no le teme a los retos ni al trabajo, está casada y es madre de dos hijas de 26 y 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y una de sus hijas a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Estela consiste en atender su propio multiservicios que tiene en su casa en donde ofrece la mayor variedad de artículos de oficina y de primera necesidad y de cuidado personal, está muy implementado y tiene de todo. Además ella presta sus servicios como costurera que hace prendas de algunos clientes y en algunos casos sus propias creaciones. Lleva con éste trabajo ya cinco años, lo hace con su hija quien le ayuda en la atención al público cuando ella está un poco ocupada con la costura. Lo que le gusta de su trabaja es que puede hacer dos actividades al mismo tiempo, además siempre tiene ingresos y muy buenos clientes ya que ahora agarro contrato con una tienda de disfraces a quienes abastece semanal, espera mas adelante poder agrandar su multiservicios y hacer un taller donde pueda coser con mayor comodidad. Este será el noveno préstamo con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo, Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas que son muy responsables y muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas materiales y productos para sus negocios, ya que desea siempre tener contentos a sus clientes y no hacerles faltar nada de lo que van en busca a su negocio.
texts.en:
48-year-old Estela is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who doesn't fear challenges, even in her work.  She is married and the mother of two daughters who are 26 and 12 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and one of her daughters who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Estela's business is working in the multi-service business that she has in her home where she sells a large variety of office supplies, basic household products and personal care products.  Her business is well stocked and she has a bit of everything.  In addition, she provides her services as a seamstress, in some cases making garments to her customers' specifications and, in other cases, making her own creations.  She has been in this line of work for five years and works together with her daughter who helps her to serve her customers when she is busy with her sewing.  What she likes about her work is that she is able to carry out two activities at once.  In addition, she always has income and very good customers since she now has a contract with a fancy dress store who she supplies every week.  She hopes, in the future, to be able to expand her store and build a workshop where she can sew more comfortably.

This will be Estela's ninth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel more secure in making progress in her business.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Estela enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more materials and products for her businesses because she always wants to keep her customers happy and not lack anything that they are looking for.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and personal products

loans.name: Nath

texts.en:
Nath is a 44-year-old single parent who has been living together with only a daughter, age 25, in Kompong Cham province. She is a local cultivator who has been involved in rice husbandry for over 10 years. Besides this, Nath has a small pig-raising business at home to ensure a better living. And presently, her daughter works for a beauty salon company as a sales clerk with a salary of USD 60.00 per month, which helps Nath as well.

With the requested amount, Nath will make some repairs to her kitchen. She wants it to be a healthier place, which will provide her family with a good living condition. Her business goal is to open a large farm for raising pigs for both slaughter and offspring in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her kitchen.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Rider quien se dedica al transporte fluvial y es padre de sus 3 hijos: Deysi, Garni y Celeste de 16, 12 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron hace poco. La actividad que realiza Alejandrina es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su casa, donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. También vende comidas por las noches como juanes, pollos asados y otros, para eso instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa, siendo muy concurrida por sus clientes quienes la prefieren por su buena sazón. Se inició de a poco comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades con un capital propio hace más de 14 años, y hasta el momento le apoyan sus hijos en la atención.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja de ambos negocios y que le han sacado de muchas dificultades.
Antes de tener ésta actividad,  tenía muchas dificultades económicas pues muchas veces con el ingreso de su pareja no les alcanzaba, además de querer sentirse una persona productiva y apoyar a su pareja en salir adelante con su familia.
Ahora, viendo los resultados que sigue teniendo con sus negocios desea continuar e implementar surtiendo con más productos su bodega. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes,. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues vienen apoyando a las personas con ganas de progresar.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para surtir su bodega, así mantener la preferencia de sus clientes, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 38 years old, is a strong-spirited and tenacious woman with a desire to get ahead. She lives with her partner, Rider, who works in river transport and is the father of her 3 children: Deysi, Garni and Celeste who are 16, 12 and 5 years old respectively. Together they live comfortably in their own home that they bought recently. Alejandrina sells basic essential groceries from a store which she has built in her home, where she serves customers -- mostly her neighbours -- with a pleasant and polite disposition. She also sells food in the evenings such as juanes (rice, chicken and egg wrapped in a 'bijao' leaf) and fried chicken among other items. For this purpose, she sets out a table in front of her house, which is frequented by customers who come for her great cookery. She started this as a small venture, selling in small quantities more than 14 years ago and now her children also help her out in this business.
She believes that her business is fairly profitable as she earns well from both of her businesses and they have pulled her through many difficult times. Before doing this, she had great financial difficulties as her husband often did not manage to earn enough; furthermore, she also wants to feel like a productive person and to support her husband in providing for the family. Now, having seen the results she has achieved with her business she wants to progress and to increase her stock in her shop.
This will be her second loan with MFP, and she is happy to know that she will have financial support to cement her plans. On the other hand, she likes her communal bank's work as they are supportive people with a desire to make progress.
With the requested amount of 1000NS, she will invest in buying basic essential groceries to stock her store and stay in favour with her customers, while seeking out lower prices for her volume purchases.

loans.use: To buy basic essential groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa, de 47 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, es casada pero su esposo vive en el extranjero y ella vive sola en su casa propia, ella trabaja mucho pues desea asegurar algunos ingresos para tener una vejez tranquila. Justa empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, cuando se va a su puesto del mercado Micaela Bastidas a abrir su stand, ahí ella empieza el día limpiando sus instrumentos de trabajo para después esperar a los clientes para hacerles buenos y bonitos cortes de pelo a caballeros y modernos cortes a mujeres, ella es dueña de dos stand, en un de ellos esta un trabajador que ella contrato y en el otro está ella. Lleva ya 21 años en éste trabajo. En el mercado en donde trabaja la conocen muy bien, pues es una mujer carismática y siempre está en lucha por los derechos de sus compañeros de puestos quienes la quieren mucho y la conocen como una mujer luchadora.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener libertad y tener a los tipos de compañeros que tiene a lado, siempre tiene clientes y por eso genera buenos ingresos, además ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente, le gustaría mas adelante poder mejorar su local y comprar mas cosas para tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus fieles clientes. Este será el crédito número 17 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas de cumplir co el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus socios son personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales para hacer su trabajo, pues le hace falta algunos cosméticos y productos diferentes con los que realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Justa, age 47, is a very hard-working and cheerful person.  She is married, but her husband lives abroad.  She lives alone in her own house.  She works a lot because she wishes to assure herself of some income for a peaceful old age.

Justa starts her work very early when she goes to open her stand at the Micaela Bastidas market.  That is where she starts her day by cleaning her work instruments.  Afterwards she waits for her customers to give good and nice haircuts to the men and modern haircuts to the women.

She owns two stands.  A worker she hired works in one of them, and she is in the other one.  She has been doing this work for 21 years.  She is very well-known in the market where she works.  She is a charismatic woman, and she is always fighting for the rights of her colleagues who also have stands.  She cares about them a great deal, and they know her to be a tenacious woman.

What she likes about her work is having freedom and having the types of companions that she has at her side.  She always has customers, and she generates good income.  She also has a lot of projects in mind .  Later on she would like to be able to improve her place.  She would like to buy more things in order to have a greater variety to offer her loyal customers.

This will be her 17th loan with MFP.  She hopes to have your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments as she has done with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy materials to do her work.  She needs some cosmetics and different products to do her work.

loans.use: to buy hair products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es: Viviana es una mujer de 25 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de cosméticos su historia empezó hace 6 años vende cosméticos a sus amigas y vecinas por salir de su casa y des estresarse actualmente tiene una vitrina en su casa con cosméticos y ropa, su trabajo lo hace sola en las tardes recorre su clientela, no tiene dificultades, está casada, tiene3 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un negocio mucho más grande y dar un mejor bienestar a sus hijos. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 25-year-old woman with many ambitions to see her cosmetics business prosper. Her story began six years ago. She sells cosmetics to her friends and neighbors, to get out of the house and to de-stress. Now she has a display case in her home with cosmetics and clothes. 

She works on her own, visiting her customers in the afternoons. She has no difficulties in her business. She is married and has three children. 

Her most important dream is to have a much bigger business and provide greater well-being for her children. That is why she wants the loan to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn is from Kompong Cham province, a region where local farmers prefer crops-growing businesses to generate income because it provides them with fertile land for most all kinds of crops, including fruits and vegetables. Orn, 35, has been working together with her spouse in this type of business for almost 20 years. She grows various kinds of crops based on the season and the market demand. She now has four children, all of whom are students attending school in different grades.

Orn is now seeking a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to continually invest in her farming business. She will buy enough farming supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, to fight against the challenge of insects and keep her crops growing well. For the future, Orn intends to buy extra land to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is married. She is 55 years old and resides at Calamba, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Concepcion owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2010, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Concepcion wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Sea is a humble and industrious farmer who permanently lives in the Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has a life partner who works as a construction laborer around the province and she has been blessed with four single children. Three of her children are still attending school. 

Sea wants to acquire her second loan from HKL to fix her present house partially on time in order to provide her children a comfortable living. Sea is confident she will pay her loan back to our lenders. As in the previous cycle, she has never had any late payments and she already paid off her prior loans.

loans.use: to fix her present house

loans.name: Veronica Esther

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer de 21 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de víveres su historia empezó que como tiene mucho tiempo laborando en un supermercado de playas y le dan a un bajo costo la mercadería pensó en poner una tienda, su trabajo lo hace con la mama y la hermana la deja abierto el negocio a las 8 de la mañana hasta que regresa, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene 2 hijos, su sueño más importante es que aspira en un futuro tener un local grande y muy estable con puertas adecuadas y bien surtido. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de víveres.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 21-year-old woman who has many ambitions to see her grocery business prosper in the coming years. Her story begins with the fact that she has worked in a supermarket in Playas for a long time. As they give her merchandise at low cost, she thought of setting up a store. 

She works with her mother and sister. They keep the store open from 8:00am until she returns.  She has no business difficulties. She is single and has two children.  

Her most important dream is to someday have a large store; very stable, with proper doors, and well-stocked. That's why she wants the loan for her grocery business.

loans.use: To sell food products and pastries.

loans.name: Boen

texts.en:
Boen is a 37-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been blessed with two school-age children who are still attending a regional school. She is an independent tailor operating the business from a place near her house. She has a team to make clothes. Each of them is responsible for different parts of the sewing process. However, it’s just her second business after rice farming. Her spouse is the main character who manages all segments of the rice farm. 

With this first loan from HKL and Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer and lubricant oil to keep for the process of doing farming in the coming season. This loan will enable Boen to produce a high rate of output from the land. Boen hopes to pursue a better standard of living through her effort and honesty at work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and lubricant oil

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is now 57 years old. She has become a single parent since her loving husband passed away a few years ago. She is presently responsible for six single children.
