Her other four children have their own families and live independently around the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. The main business of her family is to cultivate rice and other crops on inherited farmland. Typically, Chea is able to make approximately USD 5.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. 

Recently, Chea wants to be involved in a wholesaling business, as she used to have a good experience in previous years. She wants to buy cashew nuts from local villagers in bulk and stock them for while for wholesaling at a profitable price in the future. Yet she has inadequate capital to attain her goal. This time she is looking for some funds from HKL again to invest in the activities mentioned above. She is very appreciative for the loan given to her to develop a successful business

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk to sell at wholesale

loans.name: Tovuudorj

texts.en: Tovuudorj is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and all three children are students. Tovuudorj runs a car service shop. He majored in vehicle engineering, so he has a very strong background in servicing cars. Even though he's fairly new to the business, Tovuudorj's business is improving rapidly. He's a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Ever since I graduated from college, I always dreamed of opening a service shop but I never had a chance. Now that I have, I will work as hard as I can." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase tools and necessary equipment.

loans.use: to purchase tools and necessary equipment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 26 years old. She is married with four children and resides at Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Grace operates a fishing business, raising and selling seafood products, including crab, fish, and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

Grace has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for the fish. Grace has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she wants to save money as a reserve for any emergencies with her children.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the fish.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en: Tuvshinjargal is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and looks after her children. He started his taxi service business in 2007 with his own car. His car is fairly comfortable. Over the years, he gained many regular customers. His regular customers just call him whenever they want to take a cab. His service is convenient. However, His car is having mechanical problems. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have to do everything I can in order to support my children". He's requesting 300,000 MNT to fix his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin en una joven mujer, tiene 25 años, es muy trabajadora y sobre todo responsable, vive en casa de los papás de su conviviente con quien tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad, ella trabaja mucho pues lo hace para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El trabajo de Evelin consiste en la venta de comida, cuando ya empieza a caer la noche ella sale con su mesa y sillas a la vereda de su casa para empezar su jornada de trabajo diario. El tipo de comida que ella vende es muy especial pues lo hace con insumos y productos regionales, tiene una muy buena sazón y sabe como tratar al cliente para que pueda volver siempre, todos éstos  trucos de venta los aprendió durante su tiempo trabajando, pues al principio fue muy complicado pero logró adaptarse y convertirse en excelente vendedora. Lleva ya más de un año en éste trabajo, lo hace sola pues así se siente mas cómoda por que le permite tener mejores ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que tiene a disposición por el día para poder cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, siempre vende regular, espera mas adelante poder agrandar su negocio y poder comprarse una mototaxi para que lo alquile y tenga un ingreso adicional con él. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura d avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado ella se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo ya que ahí son muy puntuales.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, aumentara al capital que tiene para comprar una mototaxi ya que desea comprar uno y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Evelin is a young woman of 25 who is very hard-working and above all responsible. She lives in the home of the parents of her live-in partner, with whom she has two children, aged 3 and 1. She works a lot because she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life. 

Evelin's work is selling food. When the night begins to fall, she goes out with her table and chairs to the sidewalk in front of her home to begin her working day. The type of food she sells is very special, since she prepares it with local ingredients and supplies, it has excellent seasoning, and she knows how to treat customers so that they always want to come back. She learned all of these sales tips during her time working. At the beginning it was very complicated, but she was able to adapt and become an excellent salesperson. She has done this work for more than a year, and she does it alone because in this way she feels more comfortable, and it lets her earn a better income.

What she likes about her work is the time that she has at her disposal during the day so that she can care for her small children. Her sales are always moderate, but she hopes that in the future she can expand her business. She also wants to buy herself a moto-taxi so that she can rent it out and earn an additional income with it. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support, because this helps her feel more secure about moving ahead with her business. At the same time, she is committed once again to making her payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause any problems in her group, whose members are very punctual. 

With the amount she is requesting, 1000 soles, she will increase the capital she has to buy a moto-taxi, since she would like to buy one and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Jannyre Danitza

texts.es:
Danitza es una joven de 19 años, que desde hace 5 meses dio a luz a un pequeño que es el intenso amor de su vida y está muy contenta por ya tenerlo entre sus brazos, es una joven a la que le gusta leer y disfruta de comer Carapulcra con sopa seca, comida típica en la ciudad de Chicha, Perú.

Danitza había estado estudiando para convertirse en Analista de Sistemas, pero por distintos motivos no pudo terminar su carrera, pero está muy seguro que juntará el dinero suficiente para poder solventar los ciclos que le hacen falta terminar.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde las 4 de la tarde hasta 8, es en ese tiempo en donde atiende a un promedio de 4 clientes, sabe que le está yendo bien en su negocio porque conoce a mucha gente y estos son sus principales clientes. Fue su madre la que la animó a iniciarse en este negocio ya que ella también vende el mismo tipo de productos.

Con ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Danitza podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos y así con los ingresos que tenga, sueña con incrementar mucho más la cantidad de sus productos, las mismas que le permitirán incrementar sus ingresos y solo así podrá pagar los ciclos que le hacen en sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Danitza is a 19-year-old young woman who five months ago gave birth to a little boy who is the great love of her life. She is very happy about now having him in her arms. She is a young woman who likes to read and enjoys eating carapulcra con sopa seca (dried potatoes with meat and sauce), a traditional dish in the city of Chicha, Peru.

Danitza had been studying to become a systems analyst, but for various reasons, couldn't complete her degree. But she is quite sure she will save enough money to be able to pay for the courses she needs in order to finish.  

Currently she sells beauty products from 4:00pm until 8:00pm, and in that time serves an average of four customers. She knows her business is going well, because she knows a lot of people, and these are her main customers. It was her mother who encouraged her to get started in this business, because she also sells the same type of products.

With the help of the Kiva lenders, Danitza will be able to purchase a display case to show her products; and with the income she will have, she dreams about greatly increasing the quantity of her products, which will allow her to increase her income. Only in this way will she be able to pay for the higher education courses she needs.

loans.use: To buy a display case.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a mother of three single children, residing in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Her main business is rice cultivating and she has been in this business for over 20 years. Therefore, she has good experience and enough skills to ensure a high rate of output from her inherited farmland. She has two children to help manage her work, while the other one works as a soldier like his father.

Touch would like to receive a loan of USD 700 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to satisfy her living needs. It'll provide comfortable transportation without having to take any motor-taxis. Touch's dream is to continually support her two school-age children until they graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Dorjderem

texts.en:
Dorjderem is 46 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed; her elder three kids are school students and the youngest one is in kindergarten. 

Dorjderem started running her food cart business in 2006. She sells hotdogs, hamburgers, and other fast foods. Recently, she extended her cart due to the high demand. However, she doesn't have sufficient funds to buy the necessary foods. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my business is picking up, I need to act aggressively in order to keep it up." She's requesting 400,000 MNT to buy vegetables and meat for her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat for her food cart business.

loans.name: Uranbileg

texts.en: Uranbileg is 45 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her son is a student. Uranbileg started running her food cart business in 2007. Her food cart is at a mining site. There are only a few food carts at the mining site; therefore, her business is very profitable. She was able to send her elder daughter to college with the business profit. Uranbileg is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my youngest son is old enough to attend college, I have to make the best of my business." She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to buy grocery products.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Dashrenchin

texts.en: Dashrenchin is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed and her two kids are school students. She started her garment retailing business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. Her garments are highly fashioned and inexpensive. Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that Mongolian holiday season is approaching, I have to meet the growing number of demands. It is my golden opportunity". She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy spring garments.

loans.use: To buy spring garments

loans.name: Dogsom

texts.en: Dogsom is 24 years old and lives with her mother in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. She has been running a garment retailing business since 2011. She trades the goods at the Zanabazar market, the biggest center of the town. Dogsom brings her supplies from China once a month. She has a plan to continue her business successfully by increasing the quantity of goods she brings back, so that she can make the trip less frequently and save on transportation expenses. Dogsom is a good-natured and smart woman who says, "I would like to expand my business by getting the supplies in large quantities from China to save the transport expenses." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT for the supplies to bring from China.

loans.use: To purchase supplies from China.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, de 47 años es una buena mujer, amable y trabajadora, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia que pudo comprar gracias al arduo trabajo y esfuerzo que siempre mostró ante las adversidades y dificultades que la vida le puso en frente. El trabajo de Felipa consiste en la venta de abarrotes, se levanta temprano para ir a realizar las compras necesarias para poder vender en la bodega que tiene en su casa, además de ésta actividad posee dos mototaxis los cuales alquila a algunos conductores, en la bodega que tiene ella recibe el apoyo de sus hijos cuando están libres ya que ellos estudian gracias a lo que ella les puede brindar. Lleva realizando su trabajo por aproximadamente unos 12 años y durante ese tiempo aprendió mucho y cada día mejora. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo libre y puede usarlo para otras cosas a parte de estar en la tienda. Espera poder agrandar su tienda ya que hasta ahora le esta yendo bien y eso que recién tiene poco meses en éste negocio. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual así como lo hizo en sus créditos anteriores, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará abarrotes para seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio, además de algunas piezas y mandar al taller a reparar a sus mototaxis ya que necesitan una refacción por el deterioro sufrido por el tiempo.
texts.en:
Felipa is 47, and a nice, friendly, and hard-working woman. She is the single mother of two children, with whom she lives in her own house. She was able to buy it thanks to the hard work and effort she has always shown when faced with the adversity and difficulties that life has put before her. 

Felipa sells groceries. She gets up early to buy the things she needs to be able to sell in the small grocery store she has in her home. In addition to this business, she has two mototaxis that she rents to some drivers. 

She gets help with her store from her children when they have free time, since they go to school thanks to what she is able to offer them. She has been  doing her work for approximately 12 years, has learned a great deal during that time, and improves every day. What she likes most about her work is that she has free time, and can use it for other things apart from being in the store.

She hopes to be able to expand her store, since it is going well so far, even though she only has a few months in this business.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. This way she will feel sure of moving forward with her business. For her part, she promises to once again make her installment payments on time. 

She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all of its members are very friendly and supportive. 

With the amount of 1,200 nuevos soles applied for, she will buy groceries in order to continue making her business grow. In addition she will buy a few parts, and send her mototaxis to the shop for repairs, as they need reconditioning due to the wear they have suffered over time.

loans.use: To buy products for stocking her store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman who has six children. Regina is 48 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Regina owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting banana and root crops to sell to earn a living. She's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,800 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2009, Regina became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Regina wants to make improvements to her house and to finish education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 44 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. He started his hand crafting business in 2007. He makes little felt and leather products like key chains, dolls, wallets etc. His products are elegant and inexpensive. He also drives a cab whenever he is free. Now that the Mongolian tourist season is approaching, he needs to make a mass amount of little crafts. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says," I try not to miss any business opportunity since I am the only one with an income in the family". He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy materials.

loans.use: To buy materials to make his crafts

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 46 years old with four children. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Concepcion owns and operates a buy-and-sell of ready-to-wear clothing business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

Recently this year, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is positive and simply hopes for the business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 21 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Even though he is fairly young, he is a skilled barber who has operated his own shop since 2008. Well-known around the neighborhood, Nyamdorj's business has been growing yearly. He takes occasional hair-cutting training to keep current with new styles and techniques.

Nyamdorj is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I love what I do and I enjoy it. However, it feels like I am in the same place as I was three years ago. Therefore, I want to expand my business." He is now requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to buy an additional seat for his salon to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy an additional seat for his salon.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run, 33, is a married woman who is responsible for two school-age children. Her priority in life is to provide good education to them with a comfortable life. It’s the main reason that encourages Run to work tirelessly at the rice field and enable her to involve in various types of business to generate income as much as she can. Besides rice husbandry, she owns a small general store selling mixed merchandise to local people in her neighborhood. Moreover, she devotes a part of her time to make red sugar from palm juice brought from the tree by her husband. At the moment, she has run out of firewood to cook for the sugar as usual she does. Consequently, she would like to turn back to HKL again to borrow her fifth cycle loan to purchase firewood to stock, it’ll be used as the above mentioned to sustain her business present her business. For the future, Run wants to further improve her businesses and wishes to be a successful entrepreneur in her life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to cook red palm sugar.

loans.name: Gantogoo

texts.en: Gantogoo is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and looks after her children and two kids are school children. He started his second hand shoes trading business in 2007. He sterilizes the products before selling it. Over the years he gained many regular customers. Now that Mongolian holiday season is approaching, the product demand will increase therefore, he needs to buy supplies in order to meet the demand. He's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more shoes.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va is 50 years old and is married with 4 children, living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Va now has become a single parent and tried hard in agricultural business to raise this family and ensure a good living for her children. Two of them are already married, while the remaining children are single and live together with her. Recently Va’s elder son has just finished a course of skills learned how to be a motor fixer in Phnom Penh city. And now he wants to start running this type of business in his community. However, he really needs some additional funds to attain his goal.

Va is a good mother who always gets involved with all of her children and helps to deal with their concern as possible as she can. As of now, she is asking for a loan of USD 1,100 to supplement the existing capital to open a small shop and buy motorcycle spare parts for her son to start providing his fixing service to local people. Va hopes that her this new business will earn her family a good income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to open a small shop and buy motorcycle spare parts for her son to start providing his fixing service.

loans.name: Erdene-Ochir

texts.en: Erdene-ochir is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his kids are all school students. He started his carpentering business in 2000. Also, he operates a taxi service whenever he is free with his own motorcycle. His products are with high quality and very smooth. He makes traditionally designed chairs, tables, beds etc. Now that Mongolian holiday season is approaching his product demand is increasing. Therefore he's requesting 500,000 MNT to buy wood to make the furnitures. He's a sharp and hardworking man who says "It is my golden opportunity to expand my business."

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Moeng

texts.en:
Moeng is from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been there for ages with engaged in a type of common business as a local rice cultivator. She has been operating the business along with her spouse for over 30 years, so she has enough experiences and become very expert. However, Moeng still works by using traditional methods as well as local farmers. Moeng has 4 children. All of them quit studying while the family was experiencing financial difficulties. And now two of them are married and the other two are single.

Moeng has applying for a loan from our kind lenders to purchase a cow keep for plowing her rice field because in the past time, she used to rent it from her neighbor at the same time they were working with it. It’s the forth cycle loan of Moeng with HKL and the first one with Kiva. She tells us that it will enable her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow keep for plowing her rice field.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife looks after her children. He started his wool processing business in 2008. He started his doing his products by his bare hands. He processes wool and makes felt. He supplies to the factory. Now that his doing it for sometime, his product demand is increasing. Therefore, he's requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy wool and improve his equipment. He's a young and hardworking man who says "Now I'm father I have to be more responsible for my business in order to support my children."

loans.use: To buy wool and improve his equipment

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 46 years old and lives with his wife and four kids in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is employed, eldest kid is a college student and younger three are school students. He started his dairy product trading business in 2008. He travels through rural areas and collects dairy products, and sells it to the market traders. During the summer, he works at a construction site. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that my kid is in college, I have to work even harder in order to support him." He's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy mass amount of dairy to meet the holiday season demands.

loans.use: To buy mass amount of dairy  products

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan, 33, a married woman and a mother of three school-age children, permanently lives in Prey Chor district. She has been there with her spouse and all of her children for many years. She mainly focuses on agribusiness, especially rice husbandry, a longstanding business she’s learned from her parents and ancestors. She is typically able to earn an average of USD2.50 per day from this business.

Recently Chhan is preparing to fix parts of her house that didn’t provide her family a comfortable feeling to live in. Therefore Chhan is looking for some funds from HKL to purchase necessary construction supplies needed to get her house repaired. For her prospect, Chhan intends to buy extra farmland to increase her output and thereby make a good household income.

loans.use: to fix parts of her house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old, married, and has six children. All of her children are attending school, except for the eldest. She has been farming for seven years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk, maize, eggs, and vegetables for the local market. Margaret says she fully relies on her farming income for her family upkeep.

Margaret has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to boost her poultry business. She says she has acquired enough skills with the seven years she has been in the business and wants to significantly expand her poultry farm capacity. She wants to build a bigger housing unit for the increased number of her birds. She intends to boost her production and supply external markets as well. Another key priority for her is paying her children's school fees. 

She laments of high costs associated with animal diseases.

loans.use: To expand poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, a good region where are rich of fertile lands for growing crops, Sreng is one of the residents who has been living and operating a farming business there. She grows especially rice among the year with a great help from her unemployed children. She is a widow with eight children: seven of them are single and one is married. Three of her children are employed and work far away from the province. And normally, they share a part of their income home to help Sreng and their younger brothers and sisters who are attending in local schools.

With requested amount, Sreng will add it to her existing capital to start up a business is to sell groceries and serve soft drinks like coffee and cokes near a factory in Phnom Penh city. Her business goal is to own a grocery shops herself, without renting a booth or store from other people.

loans.use: to start up a business selling groceries.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a resident of Kitale and is aged 31 years and has been in farming for 2 years producing and selling milk and eggs to the local market. He works as a driver besides farming. He is married with 4 children with the first being 8 years and the last aged only three months.

Godfrey has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by expanding his poultry housing unit and buying more poultry birds. He says the farming income has been his main source of livelihood and expects the provision of basic family needs to be much easier with the expansion of his businesses.

Godfrey says rampant diseases and regular drought are the major challenge currently.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Rame Dane Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été créé le 20/12/2009. IL a est composé de 12 membres issues de la meme zone. Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Madame Diakhére (à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras) est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans et mére de 04 enfants. Sa principale activité est la couture, elle confectionne des habits qu'elle revend par la suite.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en tissus pour augmenter sa production et faire face à la demande de la clinetèle.

Son objectif est de participer aux charges de famille tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 20, 2009. It is made up of 12 members who are all from the same area. Their main activity is commerce.

Diakhére (on the far right side of the photograph, with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is 38 years old and mother of four children. Her main activity is sewing, and she makes clothes that she then sells.

She has lots of experience in this type of work, as she has been doing it for several years.

Her loan will allow her to stock up on fabric so that she can increase her production and meet the demand of her customers.

Her goal is to contribute to covering her family's expenses, while at the same time increasing her savings at the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is from Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Florence is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Florence runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products for the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, and many others. Florence has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month for this activity.

Florence is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchased new items to expand her products to resell. In 2007, Florence joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her products to resell

loans.name: Jepta

texts.en:
Jepta is a resident of and a farmer in the rural area of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is aged 45 and has been in farming for five years, with his farm producing and selling milk and eggs to the local market. He works as a tailor as well. He is married with two children aged three and two.

Jepta has requested a loan of KES 31,200 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says farming has been the main source of income for his family's upkeep and the acquisition of a dairy cow will provide his family with milk for family consumption and sale to provide for other basic needs.

He too concurs with many other farmers that the high cost of treatments for animals remains the daunting challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Abifuza-Iterambere/bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Abifuza Iterambere/Bgrm. Il a 40 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 3 mois à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarises. Il a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est agriculteur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique sélectionne. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait avoir un grand dépôt de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser et soigner ses enfants et sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the Abifuza Iterambere/Bgrm group.  He is 40 years old, married, and has six children ranging from 3 months to 18 years.  Three of his children go to school.  Besides his own children, he has two other dependents.  His education level is six years of elementary school.

Emmanuel is a rice farmer.  This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers.

To ensure the growth of his business, his strategy is to use selected chemical fertilizers.  In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to own a large rice warehouse.  With his profits, he is planning to send his children to school and to take care of the health of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Bailarinas Del Fraile Group

texts.es:
Bailarinas del fraile son un grupo de 8 mujeres que viven en una nueva colonia ubicada en el municipio de General Escobedo, N.L., decidieron formar un grupo para invertir en sus negocios y poder ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante; en ese momento se dieron cuenta de que entre ellas habría una bonita amistad, que eran mujeres con deseos de progresar y luchar por un futuro mejor.
Victoria es una de las integrantes del grupo, una mujer muy activa y alegre, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales siempre les ha demostrado que querer es poder y que con empeño se pueden realizar muchos sueños. Ella tiene un grupo de bailo terapia, el cual inicio asistiendo a un centro comunitario como alumna y debido a su gran energía pronto se convirtió en maestra y después la enviaron a otros lugares a capacitar a otras mujeres, con el tiempo logro rentar un local y formar su propio grupo. Este crédito le ayudara a invertir en aparatos, ya que su sueño es tener su negocio bien equipado y en un futuro hacerse de varios gimnasios.
texts.en:
Bailarinas del Fraile is a group of 8 women who live in a new neighborhood in the town of General Escobedo, N.L. (Nuevo Leon).  They decided to form the group to invest in their businesses and to be able to help their families get ahead.  They have realized that there is a nice friendship among the group and all show wishes to progress and to struggle for a better future

Victoria is one of the group members.  She is an active and cheerful woman with 3 children.  She has always shown that wishing is power and with effort you can achieve many dreams.  She has a group of dance therapy which she started attending in a community center as a student.  Because of  her energetic personality she soon became a teacher and was sent to other locations to train other women.  With time she succeeded in renting a space and forming her own group.  She will use the loan to buy equipment since her goal is to have a well-equipped business and in the future to have several gyms.
.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a gym

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne  39 ans et 5 enfants, les huit membres du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Bagadadji. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (tomate, échalotes et choux pommés), du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois, des pagnes wax et du riz. 
Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Alimata (2ème femme debout sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) ravitaille la majorité des femmes de Bagadadji en charbon de bois de qualité; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 sacs de charbon de bois avec les forains venus des villages voisins de Ségou. La revente se fait  à domicile au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCA utilisé dans l’approvisionnement de la famille en céréales et en réinvestissement  dans l’activité. Madame Alimata a pour objectif d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation à Ségou dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Danaya group all live in the Bagadadji neighborhood in Ségou (the fourth-largest administrative region in Mali), and they met through neighbors, relatives, and their revenue-generating activities at the Bagadadji market. On average, the women in the group are 39 years old and have five children. Most of them are married in monogamous families.

The group members sell condiments (tomatoes, shallots, and cabbages), firewood, charcoal, pagne cloths, and rice on a small scale.

Striving to build up their stock, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their second group loan.

Alimata (standing, second woman from the right in the photograph) supplies most of the women in Bagadadji with good-quality charcoal. She plans to use her loan to buy 50 bags of charcoal from the merchants who come from the neighboring villages of Ségou. She resells the charcoal from home for cash or credit to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000CFA to be used to stock up on cereals for her family and reinvest in her business. Alimata's goal through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land to live on in Ségou.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Pelaya

texts.es: Doña Pelaya tiene 61 años, está felizmente casada, ya tiene 30 años de unión con su esposo y ambos viven en la compañía de 3 de sus 6 hijos, con los cuales vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas. Toda su vida ha estado trabajando arduamente en las tareas agrícolas, sus años de experiencia en el cultivo de la tierra, le trae satisfacciones porque por más de 30 años ella supo junto a su esposo  sacar provecho a las actividades agrícolas y sus 6 hijos que en su mayoría son hombres y mujeres de bien  han sido sostenidos económicamente con está importante fuente de ingresos, en la actualidad se dedica enteramente al cultivo del maíz, papa, alfalfa y principalmente el trigo  las cuales ella misma se encarga de comercializar para obtener las ganancias. Su gran anhelo es ver a sus 2 últimos hijos terminando sus carreras para lo cual falta aun varios años y esa es la razón de su diario esfuerzo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el décimo sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Pelaya de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de alquiler del tractor para preparar su terreno de cultivo para la siembra de maíz.
texts.en: Pelaya is 61 years old, she is happily married, and she has already been with her husband for 30 years. They both live in the company of 3 of their 6 children, with whom she lives in her own house, located in the town of Cajas. All her life she has been working arduously at argricultural tasks. Her years of experience in cultivating the land bring her satisfaction because for more than 30 years she learned, together with her husband, how to extract profit from agricultural activities. Her 6 children, now grown, are honest men and women and have been financially supported by this important source of income. Currently she works solely at cultivating corn, potatoes, alfalfa, and principally wheat. She herself takes charge of commercializing them to obtain profits. Her great longing is to see her last 2 children finishing their studies, which will take a few years yet, and this is the reason for her daily exertions. She belongs to the communal bank “Mi banco” and this is the sixteenth loan with MFP, where she is grateful for the support from all of you since she will obtain the loan that she needs to achieve her objectives. Furthermore she promises to be punctual with the repayment installments, and the members of her association are responsible and supportive. Pelaya, once she receives her support, will invest the requested money in a payment to rent a tractor to prepare her land to sow corn.

loans.use: to rent a tractor.

loans.name: Luna Turquesa Group

texts.es: Cristina : tiene 33 años, casada, madre de 5 niños, el primero de 15 años, quien estudia la preparatoria, la segunda de 13 años, quien estudia secundaria, el tercero de 8 años de edad y el cuarto de 7 años, los dos estudian la escuela primaria y por último un niño de 4 años quien apenas cursa en nivel preescolar. Cristina tiene un negocio emprendedor, ella comenzó vendiendo joyería de plata a consignación y su marido trabaja como guardia de seguridad; ella veía que su esposo no podía con todos los gastos así que decidió unirse a un grupo solidario al  cual llamaron luna turquesa . Solicitó un préstamo grupal  para invertirlo en la compra de catálogos de zapatos y de joyería de oro, esto  era indispensable para poder surtir sus primeros pedidos y así poder reinvertir en el negocio. Su aspiración a futuro es llegar a tener un negocio establecido para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y terminar de construir su casa, ya que lo han estado haciendo poco a poco y con muchísimo esfuerzo por tantos gastos de sus hijos. Cristina espera que con la ayuda de este crédito y con su trabajo duro, pueda algún día cumplir este sueño.
texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old, married and the mother of five children.  The first is 15 and studies in high school.  The second is 13 and is in middle school.  The third is 8 years old and the fourth is 7, and they both study in elementary school.  The last is a boy of 4 years who is just at the preschool level.

Cristina has an entrepreneurial business.  She began selling silver jewelry by consignment and her husband works as a security guard.  She saw that her husband couldn't manage all the expenses so she decided to join a solidarity group that they called Luna Turquesa (Turquoise Moon).  She requested a group loan to invest in the purchase of shoe catalogs and gold jewelry.  This was necessary so that she could fulfill her first orders and then be able to reinvest in the business.  

Her aspiration for the future is to have an established business to continue helping her children in their studies and finish construction of her house, which they have been building little by little with much effort because of so many expenses for their children.  Cristina hopes that with the help of this loan and with her hard work, she will some day accomplish this dream.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of shoe catalogs and gold jewelry.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a farmer, age 52, and a father of 4 children, ages between 10 and 17 years old. Besides farming, which is his main source of income for family upkeep, he is also working as a driver. He has one farmhand and sells his farm products- milk, potatoes and beans to the local market. He has been in farming for 19 years.

Johana has requested a loan of  50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him build a modern dairy unit at 35,000 KES and to buy a chaff cutter to help ease the feeding of his growing number of dairy cows. He is optimistic about the future and hopes to repay the loan in time.

Johana has indicated that sourcing for funds to boost farming is his major challenge.

loans.use: to build a dairy unit and buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer with a huge banana plantation. He faces a problem of customers not paying on time. His dream is educating his children, building a permanent house, and buying land to grow more crops. Simon needs this loan to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Adolio

texts.es:
Adolio tiene 51 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos cuenta con casa propia en la que viven y esta ubicada en un caserío pequeño rural de nombre “San Eloy” perteneciente al distrito de de Tambogrande, y el mismo a la provincia de Piura, al norte del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Su actividad económica de Adolio es dedicarse a la agricultura y ganadería simultáneamente, pues últimamente ha sembrado plantaciones de limón y mango a los cuales les da un mantenimiento diario, y los asiste con tecnología media, ha dicha actividad se viene dedicando ya un aproximado de 15 años atrás, adicionalmente su conyugue se dedica a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de ganado ovino y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales alimenta con pastos naturales de su caserío.

Su afán de seguir creciendo comercialmente, ahora esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado el cual podría darle un mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento para ofrecerlos a mejor precio, y así obtener mayores utilidades con los que mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adolio is 51 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in his own home in the small rural village of "San Eloy", which is part of the District of Tambogrande in Piura Province and north of the Department of Lambayeque.  

Adolio's business involves engaging in agriculture and livestock breeding simultaneously.  His latest crops include lemons and mangoes, which he maintains on a daily basis through technical means.  Adolio has been in business for approximately 15 years.  In addition, his wife is in charge of raising, fattening, and selling sheep and poultry in an area behind their house.  The animals feed on the natural grasses in the village.  

Adolio's wish is to continue growing his business, so he is now requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for his livestock.  This will allow the animals to gain more weight and grow rapidly so that they can be offered at a better price.  As a result, Adolio will earn more profit so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 43-year-old gentleman, married with 8 children. He is running a business dealing in retail, which he has operated for a period of 10 years. He first carried out farming, where he got start up capital for the current business. He says the high prices and high fuel costs are the biggest threats to his business. John dreams of having his children educated and he would like to buy a car. He would like to expand his business to new markets. John wants a loan to buy sugar, salt and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and sodas for sale

loans.name: Aucilia

texts.es: Aucilia es una mujer de 60 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida su historia empezó desde muy pequeña trabajaba con el negocio de comida rápida como bollos tortillas de choclo y otros, su trabajo lo hace con su esposo trabaja muy temprano 5 de la mañana se levanta a realizar el producto de la venta del día el esposo es quien se encarga de la venta ambulante, no tiene dificultades, es unión libre y el esposo le ayuda con el esposo, si tiene hijos todos son mayores, su sueño más importante es envejecer junto a su esposo teniendo un negocio mucho más rentable y estable. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida rápida y asi comprar maiz, verdes, choclos para bollos, humitas y tortillas de choclo, etc.
texts.en:
Aucilia is a woman of 60 years of age and she has many aspirations to grow her sales of fast food in the coming years.  Her story began as a young girl working in the fast food business with rolls, corn tortillas and other items.  She works with her husband beginning very early at 5 in the morning to make her product for the daily sales.  Her husband is in charge of street sales and he has no difficulty in that.  They are in a common law marriage and her husband helps her. She has children, they are all grown.  

Her greatest dream is to grow old with her husband having a more profitable and stable business.  Because of this she wants a loan for her fast food business to buy corn, vegetables, and corn for rolls, humitas [similar to a tamale] and corn tortillas, etc.

loans.use: to purchase corn, vegetables, and corn for rolls, humitas [tamales] and corn tortillas, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married to Susan, a business lady.  They are blessed with one child aged four years.  He has been selling second hand clothes for the past nine months.  Samuel uses his monthly income of KES 15,000 to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Samuel will use the loan to buy stocks of clothes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child.  His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is married with 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Mayor's Village, Clarin, in the province of Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Cherlyn operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to her local community. She has been doing this for 5 years, and every month she earns 4,500.00 PHP from this work. Cherlyn has requested a loan of 15,000.00 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Cherlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, she hopes to double her income from her business, and that her children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Partrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 30-year-old resident of Kagadi. He is married with 3 children and runs a business dealing in produce, which he has run for a period of 5 years. Patrick started this business with capital of 1,000,000 UGX, but now he has capital of 9 million. He says the hurdles of business are the high fuel and transportation costs. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children. He would like to move his business to a more permanent location and expand to other new markets. Patrick wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 31-year-old male and a resident of Kagadi. He owns a produce business, which he has run for a period of 8 years. Robert started this business with his own personal savings and has expanded gradually. Price fluctuations and high fuel costs affect the business. He dreams of building a permanent house and wishes to buy land for farming. Robert wants a loan to buy maize, groundnuts and beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts and beans for selling.

loans.name: Rubuyu

texts.en: Rubuyu is a 38-year-old man with children. He runs a business dealing in produce, which he has operated for 5 years. His business is affected by price fluctuations and high fuel costs. Rubuyu would like to build a permanent home and move his business to a more permanent location. He wants a loan to  buy groundnuts and maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and maize for sale

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Rebecca, who is in her early 50's, is married and has five children. One of them is still at school and the rest are independent.  Rebecca has been a food vendor for 10 years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to restock the missing items in the food store and for household expenses and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more stocks of food so that she will be able to sell more food to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Momela," which has a total of 15 members.  They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 27 años convive desde hace 3 años con Juan Carlos, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Wilder y Andrea. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tapo, provincia de Tarma. Reyna es una mujer de coraje y temple luchador. Su rutina empieza en las madrugadas, cuando tiene que atender a sus pequeños hijos para ir a estudiar. Luego se dirige al mercado de su distrito, ahí tiene un puesto de ventas, donde expende carne. Lleva 2 años en este negocio. El mismo tiempo que se dedica a la siembra de papas y habas. Es una mujer muy ocupada ya que su pareja vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Lima; por eso debe contratar a jornaleros que limpien sus terrenos. Pero los fines de semana, ella coge las herramientas y se dirige a sus chacras para atenderlas. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y cuyes que enseba para luego venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Por ver a su familia feliz, está pensando aumentar la cantidad de animales, para poder tener mayores ganancias y de esa manera invertir en la compra de terrenos agrícolas, ya que cada mes tiene que pagar una suma considerable por el uso de la tierra donde siembra. Éste sería su crédito número 10 que recibiría de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo sólido de personas responsables y solidarias. Reyna invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semillas de papas y bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fertilizar sus terrenos.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 27, has been living with Juan Carlos for three years.  They have two children, Wilder and Andrea.  They live in their own house in the Tapo district, Tarma department.  Reyna is a courageous woman with a tenacious nature.

Her routine starts at daybreak when she has to take care of her little ones so they can go to school.  Then she heads to the market in her district.  She has a sales stand there where she sells meat.  She has been in this business for two years.

At the same time she devotes herself to growing potatoes and beans.  She is a very busy woman because her life partner lives and works in the city of Lima.  Therefore, she needs to hire day workers to clear the weeds from her land.  On the week-ends she gathers her tools and heads to her fields to tend to them.

She also raises small animals like pigs and guinea pigs.  She fattens them, and then she sells them at the stand where she works.  In order to see her family happy, she is thinking of increasing the number of animals that she has.  She would do this in order to have greater income.  This way she would buy more farmland because every month she has to pay a considerable sum for the use of the land she cultivates.  

This will be her tenth loan with MFP, thanks to your help.  She belongs to the Santa Cruz de Tapo communal bank.  She is happy to be part of a solid group of responsible and supportive people.

Reyna will use the requested money to buy potato seeds and bags of organic fertilizers to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Nancy Yanine

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 29 años de edad es madre de un hijo y vive junto a su esposo en casa de su propiedad , su casa esta ubicada en el caserío rural de “Guaraguaos Alto” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande, el mismo que esta en la provincia de Piura. Por ahora su caserío solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Ella de dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que viene manejando muy bien desde hace unos años atrás, realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Chiclayo y lleva su  caserío y semanalmente sale a ofrecerlos a sus clientes quienes ya le tienen bastante confianza por que les brinda una buena atención, y es su esposo el la apoya en las diferentes actividades que tiene a diario, con el fin de lograr una mejor calidad de vida y por ende una buena educación para su pequeño hijo.

Desea comprar mas mercadera y más variedades con las que pueda satisfacer a sus clientes ya que le hacen sus pedidos con anticipación, el monto que solicita es de 1500 Nuevos Soles los que le permitirán cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old and is the mother of a son. They live with her husband in their own home, located in the hamlet of Guaraguaos Alto in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura. For now their hamlet only has electricity. 

She sells clothes, a business that she's done very well in for several years. She purchases her clothes in the city of Chiclayo and then brings them to her hamlet. She offers the clothes to her well established customers on a weekly basis. Her husband helps her with her various daily activities. Her goal is to have a better quality of life and provide a good education to her small son.

She would like to purchase more merchandise and more variety so that she can satisfy her customers since they place their orders early. The amount that she is asking for is 1500 new soles which will allow her to achieve her objective.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothing.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a forty year-old hardworking lady with two children. They live in Kasese, Uganda.  Allen's personal goal is to educate her children.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last ten years. After starting with capital of five hundred thousand shillings, her  working capital has grown to over one million. Her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas.  She has applied for a loan to help her buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Raha Group

texts.en:
Marry, who is in her mid-40's, is married and has two children who are still going to school.  She has been running a grocery store for seven years now. She works from 8.00pm to midnight and has been able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for restocking the missing items in the grocery store.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a hall for entertainment and sell more items.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Raha," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the grocery store.

loans.name: Xiomara Rosario

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer muy luchadora y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que es Famoso por sus exquisitos camarones, sus machas y el encanto de sus pobladores que siempre ofrecen sus tradicionales bollos, alfajores y oquendos; Es el primer productor en el mundo de arroz por hectárea, por grandes cantidades, entre tanta producción se encuentra el arroz Tacuarí, que viene a ser el mejor y más rico arroz. Además de producir el mejor arroz, también tiene el más rico frejol; sus playas son las más extensas y más limpias del Sur del país. Los científicos dicen que son las playas más hermosas del sur y que tendría un gran futuro a nivel nacional, Xiomara es mama de un pequeño de 1 año de edad, al cual ama muchísimo y por el cual ella sale adelante cada día para darle lo mejor y lograr que sea una persona de bien y mejor que ella; como buena peruana ama la comida típica de nuestro país y uno de sus platos favoritos es el “pescado “frito”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con su bebe para distraerse un poco y que su bebe se ponga contento.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Xiomara tiene su negocio de venta de desayunos y almuerzos, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y es que Xiomara se levanta desde las cinco de la mañana para poder preparar los desayunos y poder atender temprano a sus clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque su hijo es la mejor motivación que tiene para seguir luchando a pesar de las adversidades.

Xiomara está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar meza y sillas para mejorar su local, así podrá brindarle más comida a sus clientes y le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para seguir luchando y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y que su negocio crezca”.
texts.en:
Xiomara is an enthusiastic, determined woman. She lives in the town of Camana which is famous for its shrimps and clams, and for its wonderful people who always serve their traditional baking and candy. It’s the world’s biggest producer per hectare of rice including Tacuarí rice, one of the best and tastiest types of rice there is. As well as producing wonderful rice, the area produces very good beans. It is also known for its extensive beaches, the cleanest in the south of the country. Scientists say that the beaches are the most beautiful in that part of the country and they have a great future nationally. 

Xiomara is mother to a one-year old son whom she loves greatly. Because she wants him to have a good life, she works hard every day to give him the best she can. As a good Peruvian, she loves the traditional food of the country; one of her favourite dishes is fried fish. In her spare time she likes to take her baby for walks so he can enjoy himself and be happy.

Through her efforts and dedication, Xiomara runs a business selling breakfasts and lunches. She works there about 12 hours daily, getting up at 5am to make the breakfasts and be ready to serve her customers. She believes her business is doing well because she is friendly to her customers. Because of her son she is motivated to work hard and overcome problems. 

Xiomara is very grateful to Kiva’s donors, and says it is thanks to their support that she will be able to buy tables and chairs and thus improve her premises. She will be able to provide more food for her customers and earn more money so she can achieve her dreams of providing a good education for her son and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en:
Bendera is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Bendera owns a grocery store that has been running for the last two years. She was introduced to Milango last year and joined in order to access credit.

Bendera is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase additional grocery stock (e.g. tomatoes, onions, greens and fish).
Her only challenges are the high cost of purchasing stock and the high inflation that has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. She desires to save the extra income received from this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery stock (e.g. tomatoes, onions, greens and fish).

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en:
Muzafaru wants a loan to buy public address systems. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for two years but started as a motorcycle mechanic. He lives in Masindi, Uganda, is 24 years old and has one child.

He dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include entertainment. Muzafaru needs the loan facility to buy public address systems.

loans.use: to buy public address systems.

loans.name: Akuach

texts.en:
Akuach lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are  in school. 
Akuach heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are in school. 
Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 48-year-old married man and father of four children. Hassan has been working in selling sanitary hardware for 30 years.  He is an expert in his field. Hassan is very talented, and his long experience has given him his customers' trust & support. Most of Hassan's customers are builders and plumbers working in his region.

Hassan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles and has a good standing. His previous loans helped a lot in expanding his business and reflected positively on his social & financial situations. This is why he is applying for a loan  from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua.  He hopes to increase his merchandise with special-offer products necessary for his business.

Hassan looks forward to providing his family with the best education and living ever.  He hopes to expand his business as much as he can in the future. His good reputation is his main source of marketing.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special-offer products requested by his customers

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has five children.  Three of them are in school. 
Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her fourth loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 1500 in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora, está casada y es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven con ella en su casa propia, ellos son por quienes cada día se esfuerza para darles lo mejor en educación y calidad de vida. Martha durante muchos años trabajo y se esforzó mucho, actualmente tiene como actividad el de la venta de abarrotes en general, además de bebidas heladas y una productora de cigarros mapacho (un tipo de cigarro regional). Lleva ya 4 años con su bodega, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposo con quienes se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que beneficia a todos.
Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades como las ya mencionadas, éste negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su producto y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que tiene como clientes, tiene muchas ganas de seguir superándose y es por eso que esta iniciando un nuevo negocio de venta de comida, del cual no sabe mucho pero que tiene todas las ganas de aprender y hacerlo progresar. Este será el crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores, está muy contenta de perteneces a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para empezar su nuevo negocio de venta de comida, además algunos abarrotes para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
54-year old Martha is a hardworking, enterprising woman. She is married and has five children, only two of whom still live with her in her own home. It is for her children’s education and standard of living that she makes such an effort every day. She’s been doing this for many years. Currently Martha sells groceries and cold drinks. She also makes ‘cigarros mapacho’, a type of local cigar. She’s had her store for four years which she runs with help from her children and husband. She is happy to be able to share a business that benefits so many people.

Martha enjoys her work because it allows her enough time to be able to do other activities. It generates a good income as there are always customers for her products which she sells to wholesalers. She is eager to continue doing well so she is starting a new business selling food. She doesn’t know much about it yet but is very keen to learn and make progress. 

This will be her eleventh loan with MFP, and she hopes that with the organization’s help she will be able to continue achieving her objectives. For her part, she promises once again to pay back the money, just as she has with previous loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank as all the members are friendly, committed people. 

With the S/.2,000 loan, Martha will buy materials, ingredients, and supplies to begin her new business selling meals. As well she wants to buy some groceries to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products for her store and supplies for her new food-making business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a fifty-five year-old hardworking lady living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has been selling clothes as her business and has achieved working capital of three million shillings after starting with five hundred thousand shillings.The major challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.  However, she has a goal of expanding her business to other areas. Beatrice needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 52 years old.  He is married and has 4 children. He runs a grocery store to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed one person. He does pea farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, bananas, oranges, mangoes, potatoes and onions to sell.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, bananas, oranges, mangoes, potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es un mujer de 30 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar sus ventas en cosmeticos. 

Su historia empezó desde antes cuando tenía un local pero ahora decidió vender ambulantemente porque le resulta mejor la venta de ropa y cosmeticos. Lo escogió porque le gusta el comercio y hablar con las personas. Su trabajo lo hace sola, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, si tiene 1 hijo, su sueño más importante es darle un mejor porvenir a sus hijos. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para que sus ventas aumenten comprando ropa y cosmeticos Yanbal.
texts.en: Luz is a woman of 30, and she has many aspirations for her business to prosper in the coming years. Her story began some time ago, when she had a store, but now she has decided to sell as a walking vendor, because her sales of clothing and cosmetics are better. She chose this because she likes business. She does her work alone. She doesn't have any problems. She is single and has one son. Her most important dream is to give a better future to her child. For this reason, she wants the loan to buy more clothing and Yanbal cosmetics so that her sales will increase.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Sara Pilar

texts.es: Sara es un mujer de 61 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar economicamente en su negocio de confeccion. Su historia empezó hace 25 años la mama es costurera y ella aprendió, su trabajo lo hace sola y el horario es de 8:00 hasta la hora que sea, no tiene dificultades, está soltera, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es que desea su taller y para ello necesita comprar maquinas industriales. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su taller comprar telas y una maquina de coser.
texts.en: Sara is a woman of 61 who has many aspirations for her products to be successful in the coming years. Her story began 25 years ago. Her mother is a seamstress, and she learned (from her). She does her work alone, and her schedule is from 8:00 am until whatever hour. She doesn't have any particular problems. She is single and has no children. Her most important dream is that she wants a workshop, and for that she needs to buy industrial machines. This is why she is applying for the loan, to buy fabrics and a sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.use: maquina de coser y telas

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, está casada hace muchos años y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y dos nietas de 13 y 17 años a quienes les da educación e intenta brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mercedes consiste en la venta de carbón, plátano y bebidas gaseosas, además de realizar una actividad diferente y en sociedad con su hijo, ella envía combustible a una zona minera para que su hijo lo venda a los buscadores de oro artesanal. Durante el ultimo año que realiza éste trabajo, le está yendo ya que el trabajo con su hijo es muy transparente y siempre le rinde cuentas claras. Vende el combustible mas limpio y de mejor calidad del lugar, eso le permite tener buenos clientes que siempre buscan su producto para adquirirlo. Le gusta su trabajo por que en su casa puede vender algunas cosas mientras que por otro lado su hijo también le hace producir a su dinero, que se dio cuenta es muy rentable pues es la décima vez que envía y las veces anteriores le salió muy bien todo. Ella espera poder comprar muchos mas productos para seguir abasteciendo a su hijo y así puedan seguir creciendo. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, por ellos espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará mas plátanos y carbón para continuar con su trabajo, además enviara mas combustible a la zona minera para seguir con ese negocio.
texts.en:
60-year old Mercedes is a good, hardworking woman. She’s been married for many years and lives in her own home with her husband and two granddaughters aged 13 and 17. She is educating them and wants to give them a better standard of living. Mercedes sells charcoal, bananas, and soft drinks. She also runs a different business with her son--she sends gas to a mining area where her son sells it to the men seeking gold there. During this past year that she’s been working with her son, the business has done well and the accounts are clear and transparent.

The gas she sells is the cleanest and best quality in the area so she has good customers who always look for her product. Mercedes enjoys her work as she can sell some items in her store while her son is also earning money so between them they bring in good money. She’s sent him gas on ten previous occasions and each time it has gone well. 

Mercedes hopes to be able to buy more products that her son can sell so their business can grow. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes that with the organization’s help she will be able to achieve her goals. For her part, she promises once again to pay back the money, just as she has with previous loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank as all the members are responsible, committed people. 

With the S/.2,500 loan she will buy more bananas and charcoal for her home business and send gas to the mining area to continue with that business too.

loans.use: to buy bananas, charcoal, and gas

loans.name: Luzmila Marlene

texts.es:
Luzmila es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 4 años, al cual adora mucho y da la vida por él, su vivienda está ubicada en el departamento de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles, como buena peruana ama la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de los platillos que más le gusta es el  riquísimo “Seco de Pollo”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música ya que le ayuda a relajarse.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece productos de calidad.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva  ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (ropa de temporada de verano), así podrá seguir trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener un local en el centro de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 22 years old and lives with her partner and her 4-year-old son, whom she adores and would do anything for.  Their home is located in the department of Ica.  Ica department is the only region of the south coast that is made up entirely of coastal plains, since the Andean Cordillera runs further inland at that point.  Ica’s landscape includes vast deserts, such as the Pampas de Lancha and the Pampas de Villacurí, where the heat is very intense.  The region also has beaches and thermal springs, a variety of marine animals, museums at archaeological sites, and excellent hotels.  

As with all good Peruvians, Luzmila enjoys traditional food; one of her favorite traditional dishes is the very rich “Seco de Pollo” [“dry chicken”—a Peruvian stew].  In her free time she enjoys listening to music, which helps her relax.

Luzmila has a business selling clothing and beauty products, which she managed to set up with a great deal of effort.  Her business is open 8 hours a day, and she thinks it is going well because she is kind to her customers and offers them quality products.

Luzmila is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business (specifically, summer clothing) thanks to their help.  The loan will allow her to keep working so she can achieve her main goal: to have a space where she can set up her business in the city center.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucero Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
