Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her shop.

loans.name: Noe Raul

texts.es:
Noe Raul tiene 70 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos tiene 5 hijos de 48, 46, 44, 42 y 21 años. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La ventanilla se llama PITA se encuentra ubicada En el Recinto San Pablo de Pita perteneciente al Canton Caluma a 45 minutos de Montalvo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. 

Noe Raul se dedica a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, naranja,orito y guineo ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en Comercial San Rafael en Caluma y las vende en Montalvo. 

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como:abonos, urea y fungicidas para la malesa o mala hierva, ranger para las enfermedades en los cultivos . El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño es increentar la produccion tener productos de calidad para tener dinero para la familia. Ha enfrentado desafios como enfermedades en la familia.

En los tiempos libres de gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Noe Raul is 70 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and five children, ages 48, 46, 44, 42, and 41.  He lives in Montalvo in the Los Ríos province.

The PITA communal bank is in the San Pablo de Pita precinct in the Caluma canton.  It is 45 minutes from Montalvo.  This communal bank devotes itself to agricultural work.  They grow oranges, “guineo” and “orito” (types of plantains), cacao, and coffee.

Noe Raul devotes himself to caring for his cacao, orange, orito, and guineo crops because these are long cycle products.  He makes his purchases in Comercial San Rafael in Caluma, and he sells them in Montalvo.

The loan he is requesting is to buy supplies like fertilizers, urea, fungicides for the weeds, and herbicide for diseases in the crops.  The loan has helped him to increase the quality of the products, and it has helped avoid losses in the crops.

His dream is to increase production and to have quality products in order to have money for his family.  He has faced challenges like illnesses in the family.

He likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, fungicides for the weeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram has operated his retail business in Nakuru town for the last 4 years. He is married to Veronicah, and they have three children who are in school.

He was introduced KADET LTD  by a fellow client and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy bread, milk, eggs and soft drinks to add to his stock. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member.

In future, Joram hopes to grow his retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy bread, milk and eggs for resale.

loans.name: Ventura Del Carmen

texts.es: Ventura Del Carmen es una de las emprendedoras que se le apoyado brindándole financiamiento para la compra de productos para la pulpería aumentando su productos y sus clientes, hoy en día tiene bastante clientes que la visitan para comprar sus productos les ofreciéndoles variedad de productos. Actualmente esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos, pan, tomate, entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ventura Del Carmen is one of the entrepreneurs that has been supported by a loan.  She used the loan to buy products for her small grocery store; she increased her products and her customers.

Nowadays she has plenty of customers who come to buy her products, and she offers them a variety of products.

This enterprising woman is now requesting a loan to buy products like sweets, soft drinks, juices, detergent, basic grains, bread, and tomatoes, among other products that are in customer demand.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, juices, detergent, basic grains, bread, and tomatoes, among other products that are in customer demand.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married and has three children between the ages of 22 and 27 who are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past five years Sarah has been into a charcoal business. She enjoys the buying, because she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 48 years old and married with five children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. In future, Lydia hopes to buy a pickup truck, which she will be using to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Hope Alive Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Rosemary from Mutare, the capital of the Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is widowed with three children who are all attending school. She runs a business of selling clothes. The business has been in operation for at least four years. She says the main challenge faced is transportation. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $800 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance her family's welfare. In the future Rosemary plans to expand and be in a position to employ a minimum of 5 workers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 35 years old, married to Esther, and they have a daughter. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. In future, Antony hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Denia Xiomara es una joven microempresaria de la comunidad de San Nicolás, es una joven soltera  y no tiene hijos. Denia se dedica a la venta de golosinas y tiene una cafetería en el centro de educación de la Aldea. Trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hermanas y el negocio lo abre desde las 6:00 A.M hasta las 4:00 P.M. Su negocio le resulta muy rentable en el periodo escolar de febrero a octubre, en los meses de noviembre a enero sus ventas disminuyen ya que entra el periodo de vacaciones y a veces por las huelgas de los maestros. El préstamo que solicita Denia lo necesita para surtir su cafetería con la  compra de  productos como ser: refrescos, churros, dulces, jugos, verduras, carnes, harina, entre otros. El mayor deseo de Denia es el de aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y negocio. Denia es clienta de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Denia Xiomara is a young businesswoman from the San Nicolás community.  She is a single young woman, and she does not have children.

Denia sells sweets, and she has a cafeteria in the education center of the village.  She works with one of her sisters, and the business is open from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  Her business is very profitable during the school season from February to October.  During the months from November to January sales diminish because it is vacation time.  Sometimes sales diminish because of teacher strikes.

Denia needs the loan that she is requesting to stock her cafeteria with products like soft drinks, churros, candy, juices, vegetables, meat, and flour, among others.  

Denia’s greatest wish is to increase her income in order to improve household and business finances.  Denia has been a client of FAMA for various cycles.  She has made her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy candy, churros, soft drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon's business is doing great. He has applied for his second loan. He paid for his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. In future, Simon hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: To buy farm produce and transport it to the market for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 29 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 11, both of whom attend school. For the past two years she has been operating a small shop where she sells soft drinks, juice and water. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, juice and water to expand her business. In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, juice and water to expand her business.

loans.name: Mudzimai Wanhasi Group

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Joyce from Mutare. She is married with five children, four of whom attend school.  Joyce runs an agriculture business, raising poultry. The business has been in operation for several years. She says the main challenge she faces is that poultry feeds are sometimes not available. Joyce has requested a loan of $800 to buy one-day-old chicks to raise for eggs. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay university fees for her children. In the future Joyce plans to grow the business to a large scale.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Jaime Enrique

texts.es: Jaime, de 26 años de edad, originario de Chacaraseca una comunidad rural localizada en las afueras de León, es casado no tiene hijos inicio. Sus actividades las empezó a  los 19 años  de edad se independizo siempre ha trabajado en la agricultura y en especial en la crianza de cerdos sus padres le enseñaron ya que ellos se dedicaban a los mismo. Este  ha sido su negocio ahora lo apoya su esposa no tiene otros ingresos comercializa su producto en su comunidad  en base a esta actividad mantiene a su familia. Su expectativa es crecer  comprar ganado. Este préstamo lo solicita para compra de cerdos le va ayuda a crecer y mejorar la crianza de estos animales, mantenerlos en condiciones mejores para su desarrollo. Sus planes futuros es tener su ganado y siempre  trabajar en la agricultura
texts.en: Jaime is 26 years old.  He is from Chacaraseca, a rural community located on the outskirts of León.  He is married but has no children.  He began this activity when he was 19 years old and became independent.  He has always worked in agriculture and especially in raising pigs.  His parents also raised pigs so they taught him.  This has been his business, his wife helps him.  He doesn't have any other income.  He markets his product in his community.  Through this business he supports his family.  He expects to improve his business by buying livestock.  He requests this loan to buy pigs.  The loan will help his business grow by helping him raise the animals better, maintaining them in better conditions for their development.  His future plans include having  a livestock and always working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su única hija, cuentan con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un pequeño caserío que se llama “El Sol” en el distrito de Chulucanas, perteneciente a la provincia de Morropón a unas 4 horas aproximadamente de la Ciudad de Chiclayo. El caserío donde vive es pequeño y esta en la parte rural de la Provincia.

Desde hace 7 años atrás Margarita cuenta con una bodega en la que vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, pollo, verduras, en otros, y esta instalada en su propio domicilio, ya a la fecha tiene sus propios clientes quienes acuden a su bodega por que saben que les brindarán una buena atención y encontrarán lo que ellos buscan. Su esposo es trabajador de una empresa agrícola en la que recibe sus sueldos de manera quincenal con lo que ayuda al sustento de su familia.

Margarita desea surtir mas su bodega y necesita capital de trabajo para lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles con lo que comprará mas abarrotes y pueda mantener atendida a su clientela, inversión que le permitirá obtener mayores utilidades y pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 29 years old, she lives with her husband and her only daughter.  She owns her own house which is located in a tiny hamlet called "El Sol" in the district of Chulucanas, belonging to the Morropón province.  It is approximately four hours from the city of Chiclayo.  The hamlet in which she lives is tiny and it is in the rural part of the province.

Margarita has had a small store for seven years now, she sells basic foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, chicken, vegetables, among other things.  The store is in her home.  Currently she has her own customers who come to her store because they know they will get great service and they will find what they are looking for.  Her husband works at a agricultural company.  He gets paid every two weeks and this helps support the family.

Margarita wishes to stock up her store and needs working capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2500 Nuevos Soles.  With this money she will buy more groceries and be able to take care of her clientele.  This investment will allow her better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs such as sugar, rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Lester

texts.es:
Lester, de 29 años de edad, habita en la comunidad Chacaraseca, León, de oficio agricultor, padre de 1 hijo de 3 años de edad. Sus actividades en el campo las empezó desde muy joven pues las siembras y preparación de terreno fueron las primeras actividades que el aprendió pues su familia lo trae por tradición con el tiempo se fue especializando en la crianza de cerdos y ganado. De hecho hoy en día una de la actividades que más le gusta y con la que mantiene a su familia es la crianza de animales.
El necesita el crédito para comprar un buey, el cual usara para preparar la tierra para siembra de sus cultivos. Además quiere seguir mejorando la crianza de ganado por eso una de sus expectativas es comprar vacas y terneros para diversificar sus animales y obtener mejores ingresos que le ayuden a darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lester, 29, lives in the community of Chacaraseca, León, a farmer by trade and the father of a 3-year-old child.  He began his work in the fields from a very young age because planting and preparing the soil were the first jobs he learned.  His family does it by tradition and in time came to specialize in raising pigs and cattle.  In fact, these days one of the activities he most likes and with which he supports his family is raising animals.

He needs the loan to buy an ox, which he will use to prepare the soil to plant his crops.  He also wants to continue improving raising livestock, so one of his goals is to buy cows and calves to diversify his animals and get better income to help give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an ox.

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es: Domingo Leonel tiene 51 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en  general el negocio lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercado de la localidad donde ya tiene sus clientes que la visitan para comprar sus productos. Este negocio lo emprende de la necesidad de generar ingresos para la familia y apoyar a su esposa en los gastos del hogar, por la experiencia que tiene en el negocio los clientes lo visitan por la variedad de producto que ofrecerles. Domingo Leonel está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de camisas, sandalias, blusas, blúmer, short, pantalones entre otros productos que sus clientes los solicitan
texts.en: Domingo Leonel is 51 years old and his business is selling general merchandise.  His business is located in one of the markets in his town and he already has his customers who visit him to buy his products.  He started this business as he needed to make income for his family and support his wife with their household expenses.  He has experience in his business and his customers visit him because of the variety of products that he sells.  Domingo Leonel is requesting a loan to buy shirts, sandals, blouses, shorts, pants and other products that his customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy shirts, sandals, blouses, pants, shorts and other products that his customers are requesting

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 24 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó hace varios años ella empezó con un pequeño préstamo con el cual empezó a invertir y de ahí poco a poco y comprar más vitrinas, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es poder crecer un poco más en su negocio y mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su salón de tienda.
texts.en: María is a 24-year-old woman who has many goals for her store to prosper in the coming years.  Her story began a few years ago.  She began with a small loan with which she began to invest and, as a consequence, to buy more display cases little by little.  She does her job alone.  She has problems with crime.  She is married with one daughter.  Her most important dream is to be able to grow a little bit more in her business and improve her family's income.  This is why she wants the loan for her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, grains, and beverages.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 55 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su mini tienda su historia empezó cuando sus hijos crecieron y se independizaron se puso un negocio, su trabajo lo hace con sus hijos todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 4 hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una tienda. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su salón de mini tienda y asi comprar confites, dulces.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 55-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her mini store business over the next few years.

When Isabel's children grew up and became independent she decided to set up a business.  She works with her children every day and doesn't experience any difficulties.  Isabel is not married and has four children.  Her biggest dream is to own a store.  She would like this loan for her mini store so that she can buy snacks and candies.

loans.use: to buy snacks and candies

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en un caserío pequeño de nombre “Saltur”, el lugar es una zona turística donde los pobladores se dedican mayormente a la venta de animales menores y la artesanía, esta ubicado a una hora aproximadamente de la Provincia de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 11 años atrás el se dedica a la venta de animales menores y carne de cerdo en los mercados aledaños a su caserío, cuenta ya con una gran cantidad de clientes quienes realizan sus pedidos con anticipación para lo que Walter recorre los caserío comprando cerdos los cuales engorda y luego comercializa como carne. 

Esta solicitando un crédito a edpyme Alternativa por un monto de  2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en la compra de cerdos para con el fin de aumentar sus ventas.
Tiene buenas referencias de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter is 48 years old and married.  He lives together with his family in a small village called Saltur.  It is in a tourist area and the locals mainly work selling animals and making handicrafts.  It is approximately one hour from Chiclayo province.

Walter has been selling animals and pork meat in neighboring markets for 11 years.  He already has a large number of customers who place their orders in advance so he goes around the villages buying pigs which he fattens and then later sells as meat.

Walter is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying pigs so that he can increase his sales.  He has good references from his customers.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs)

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Mario Jesus, el socio es músico de profesión, el socio tiene una agrupación musical llamada Aroma, él y su grupo se presentan para amenizar todo tipo de compromisos como matrimonios,bautizos,fiestas de cumpleaños entre otros y tocan todo tipo de canciones como salsa, huaynos, criollas, boleros, vals, tangos, baladas, pop, rock; el socio es una persona bien responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia siendo de esta manersa que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para renovar un equipo de musica y parlantes.

El socio está feliz con el préstamo que le otorgaran y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Mario Jesus belongs to the 'Hacia el Triunfo' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department. Mario Jesus is a musician by profession. He has a band called Aroma and he and his group liven up all kinds of events such as weddings, baptisms, birthday parties, etc. They play all kinds of music such as salsa, huaynos, Creole music, boleros, waltzes, tangos, ballads, pop and rock. He is a very responsible person who has a great desire to make progress for his family's sake. This is how he provides for his family. Mario Jesus is requesting this loan to replace a piece of musical equipment and some speakers. He is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to replace a piece of musical equipment and some speakers

loans.name: Jenniffer Yadira

texts.es: Jennifer es una mujer de 22 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su salón de belleza y peluquería su historia empezó porque me gusta ser estilista pura tener ingresos propios, su trabajo lo hace sola todos los días, no tiene dificultades, no está casada, tiene 1 hija, su sueño más importante es terminar el local en mi casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su salón de belleza-peluquería por eso quiere el prestamo para construir mejor su peluqueria comprando cemento, arena, bloques.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a 22-year-old woman who has a great desire to boost her beauty salon and hairdressing business over the next few years.

Jennifer started out in this business because she enjoys working as a stylist and making her own income.  She works alone every day and does not experience any difficulties.  She is not married and has one daughter.  Jennifer's biggest dream is to finish building her premises in her home.  She would like this loan for her beauty salon / hairdressing business so that she can improve its construction, buying cement, sand and blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and married to Aineah and together they have two children. She operates a detergents and soap-making business. She supplies  neighboring customers and traders in the market.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of chemicals for soap making.

In the future, Emily plans to grow her business and start a soap-making industry, hence becoming one of the leading business people in the region.

loans.use: To add more stock of chemicals for soap making.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is still running his bakery. He bakes and sells bread and lavash and thus provides for his family. 

Davit used his first Kiva loan to buy a stove for baking lavash. Now he is seeking a $3,000 loan to purchase flour wholesale for his business.

loans.use: to purchase flour wholesale for his business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has a timber business that he has been doing for the past six years. He is married to Jane and they have three children who are all in school.

Edward has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more timber to add to his stock. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member.

He hopes to expand his business and open a timber yard.

loans.use: To buy more timber.

loans.name: Lillian.

texts.en:
Lillian has operated her retail business in Olkalou town for the last two years. She is 35 years old, married to John, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more sugar, flour and cooking oil to add to her stock.

In future, Lillian hopes to grow her retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos es un hombre de 32 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó dentro de su sector en su barrio no hay tiendas entonces empezó vendiendo arroz y cada vez le pan le pedían más, su trabajo lo realiza con su familia todo el día, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casado, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una despensa y un camión pequeño. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda y asi comprar bebidas, enlatados, granos, dulces.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 32-year-old man who has a great desire to boost his business over the next few years.

Carlos decided to open his store because there weren't any stores in his neighborhood.  He started out selling rice and his customers asked him for more products.  He works together with his family every day.  The difficulty he faces is crime.  Carlos is married and does not have any children.  His biggest dream is to own a grocery store and a small truck.  He would like this loan for his store so that he can buy drinks, canned food, grains and candies.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned food, grains and candies

loans.name: Nyashadzedenga Group

texts.en:
This is 57 year old Everjoice from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is widowed with four children. She also cares for three dependents. 

Everjoice runs a business of selling clothes. The business has been in operation for six years. She says the main challenge she faces is that the market place is not well secured and therefore she often loses items to thieves. 

Everjoice has requested a loan of $400 to add to her stocks for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance her family's welfare. In the future, Everjoice plans to open a bigger clothing sales shop in town.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is 35 years old. He lives in the village of Sadzeli in South Georgia with his family: his wife, Alice, his parents and his younger brother. 

All his family members are busy with the family livestock farm. They purchase calves and keep them for five or six months. After this period, the family sells the grown calves for a higher price and gets income. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL.

Azat requested a loan for purchasing calves. He will increase the number of calves in the farm and get increased income after six months. The family will use the additional income to purchase needed household goods and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Benotto

texts.en:
Benotto is 19 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and stopped her education at grade six. She has a 1-year-old child who lives with her.

For the past two years, she has been selling rice by cups in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers, and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by bags for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by bags for her business.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah has operated her retail business in Nakuru town for the last six years. She is 34 years old and married to Elijah and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of rice, salt, match boxes and soft drinks for sale in her shop and therefore have enough stock to meet her customers' demands as well as to increase her income.

In future, Linah hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop and even build residential premises.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, salt, match boxes and soft drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She has been in the shoe selling business in Nakuru town for the last four years.

Rose is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of new shoes to sell in her business.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their field officers.  In the future, Rose hopes to open a shop and stock it with imported shoes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new shoes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and married. She and her husband, Musa, are blessed with three children, ages 10, 3 and 1. Emily owns a grocery store, a business she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

Emily is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase fruits and vegetables for sale. The profit she earns from this loan will help her buy a dairy cow for milk production in order to increase her income. 

Emily's hope is to one day buy a car as well as see her children get a good education. This is Emily's first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en: Bindu is 30 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children, ages  6 to 12. For the past 5 years, she has been selling palm oil by the gallon in the local market. She makes a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Bindu hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 18 years old, single and lives in Buchanan. She stopped her education at grade 10. For the past 3 years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She established the business with small loans from her father. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 41 years old and married to Charles. They are blessed with four children. She sells cereals in Kamulu, Tala. She has been in this business for the last three years and gets an income of 18,000 KES per month.

Rose has a good credit history with KADET, Ltd. She is applying for her second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET, Ltd., with which she plans to buy stock like beans, maize, and groundnuts. She will use the extra profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to have a business that has expanded fully and a family that has a good supply for its basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase stock like beans, maize, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children, ranging in age from 16 to 28. All of them attend school. For the past 11 years, Hawa has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started her business with capital from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia lives in the village of Abastumani in South Georgia with her family, including her husband, Avtandil, two sons (23 and 20 years old) and father-in-law. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. They have a dairy farm where Lia produces cheese. Also, the family grows vegetables on a family-owned plot of land. 

Lia also runs a small grocery store in the village. She sells harvested vegetables as well as homemade cheese in her store. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL.

Lia has requested credit so she can purchase calves. Avtandil will take care of the calves and feed them for six months. After six months, Avtandil and Lia will sell the calves for a higher price and earn additional income. The family will use the additional income to purchase necessary household goods and to improve family members' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old. She supports her two children, ages 17 and 13 years respectively. She runs a tailoring shop as well as a grocery. She started tailoring 2 years ago and the business earns her a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase clothes materials for sale. The profit she makes will be plowed back into her business. Her dream is that one day she'll be able to build rental houses. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials

loans.name: Oganes

texts.en:
Oganes lives in the village of Skhvilisi, South Georgia. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Kristine, 5-year-old daughter and parents. Oganes works as a construction worker in his district. At the same time, he leads the agricultural business of the family. His mother assists Oganes. His father has health problems and gets a relevant monthly pension from the government. Oganes grows potatoes on a family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested potatoes in the village and to green grocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 GEL.

Oganes requested credit for purchasing better-quality potato seeds. He will get more harvest and sell it locally. The income of the family will increase. Oganes plans to use increased income for financing family daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 23-year-old single man who started a taxi business a year ago. He has requested a 20,000 KES loan to service his car. This is his first loan.

Profit from his business will help James repay his loan. His dream is to make his business big.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie  is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has an 11-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past 20 years, she has been selling biscuits and juices. She enjoys being self-employed.

Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits and juices for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits  and juices for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old and supports his brothers and sisters. Four years ago, he started a business selling second hand shoes, and now he earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Daniel has requested a 30,000 KES loan to buy more shoes for sale. The profit he earns will help him repay his loan and increase his stock. This is his first loan. 

Daniel's dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for sale.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 40 years old. He lives in the village of Shoka with his family: wife – Pirimze, 18-year-old son and 15-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. 

Teimuraz leads the agricultural business of the family. He runs the family dairy farm with four milk cows. Pirimze and Teimuraz produce Georgian cheese and sell, on average, 80 kg of this product on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 300 GEL.

Teimuraz requested credit for expansion of his dairy farm. He will purchase a milk cow and will increase production and sales of cheese by 25%. The income of the family will increase. Teimuraz plans to use increased income for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is from the village of Kumurdo. She lives with her mother-in-law and sister-in-law in the village. All of her family members are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. They have a dairy farm with four milk cows. Oksana produces cheese and sells it in the local market. The family also owns 2.5 hectares of land, where they grow potatoes, wheat, and barley. They sell their harvested products locally to greengrocery wholesalers in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Oksana requested credit for purchasing quality potato seeds. She will sow good quality potatoes, which can be sold for higher prices to create more income for the family. Oksana plans to reinvest part of the received income in the same business, to sow more potatoes. Part of the income will also be used for financing the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 38 years old, married to Agnes, and is blessed with two children aged 14 and 10 years respectively. He is a farmer. He started the business five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a generator for pumping water in his garden. The profit he makes from his business would help him buy a dairy cow for milk production. 

His dream is to one day become a large scale farmer and buy a large piece of land. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for pumping water in his garden.

loans.name: Mawulawoé

texts.fr:
Mawulawoé est une femme âgé(e) de 27 ans. Elle est mariée à comptable. Elle a 02 enfants .Le premier a 03 ans et le dernier a 01 an.  
Mawulawoé travaille comme revendeuse de condiments depuis 2009. Elle vend seule aux clients dans un marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Mawulawoé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Mawulawoé voudrait louer une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Mawulawoé is a 27-year old woman, who is married to an accountant; She has two children: the eldest is three years old and the youngest one year old. Mawulawoé has been working as a retailer of condiments since 2009. She sells alone to customers on the market and gets her supplies in Lomé. Mawulawoé has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy condiments. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years she would like to rent a shop. She says that she will provide for her family's needs with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Agbessi

texts.fr:
Agbessi est une femme âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée à un conducteur d’engin. Elle a 2 enfants. 01 va à l’école. Le premier a 26 ans et le dernier a 18 ans.
Agbessi travaille comme maraichère  depuis 1987. Elle produit et vend des produits maraîchers pour tous clients au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Agbessi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des intrants pour la production des produits maraîchers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Agbessi voudrait acheter un terrain à exploiter. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’impliquer sa famille dans la production.
texts.en: Agbessi is a 50-year old woman, who is married to an engine driver. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. The eldest is 26 years old and the youngest 18. Agbessi has worked as a market gardener since 1987. She produces and sells market gardening products to all types of customer at Lomé's Grand Market. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone and at the moment her main problem is a rupture of stock. Agbessi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES so that she can buy agricultural inputs for the production of her market gardening products. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Agbessi would like to buy a land to cultivate. She says that she is planning to include her family in the production with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy market gardening products

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Fati est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.
Fati travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des ignames et du charbon de bois pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toute sa clientèle.
Fati a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Fati voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Fati is a 38-year old woman, who is married to a driver. She has two children, who are both at school. The eldest is five years old and the youngest two. Fati has worked as a retailer since 2003. She sells yams and charcoal to all sorts of customers on the market. She buys the produce in Lomé and works alone. Her main problem at the moment is not to be able to satisfy all customer demand. Fati has requested her third loan from WAGES so that she can buy yams and charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the next few years, Fati would like to expand her business and she says that she will take care of her family with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy yams and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old and a mother of two children aged 14 and 7, respectively. She sells second hand clothes, a business she ventured into a year ago.  She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 14,500 that she will use to pay school fees for her children, this is her second loan.  Her dream is to be a millionaire one day.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old. She sells maize, which she has been doing for five years. 

Melanie is requesting a loan to buy more maize and upgrade her business. She believes that profits from the business will help her to build a house for her residence. In the future, she wants to sells a wider variety of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is 48 years old. She is requesting a loan to add more boutique items, such as salt, sugar, and soaps, to sell. With the profits, she plans to build a house. In the future, she plans to request a larger loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, soaps, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 38 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 19 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past twenty-four years Hellen has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She gets a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.en:
Baghdasar is 33 years old. He lives in village Diliska, South Georgia with his family which includes his wife Goar, 3 year old daughter and 1 year old son. Goar is a housewife. Baghdasar works as loader in the village. Along with his job, he is responsible for the agricultural business of the family.  He grows potatoes on a family owned plot of the land. Baghdasar sells potatoes in the village to greengrocery wholesalers. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Baghdasar requested a loan to purchase quality potato seeds and fertilizers. After proper cultivation and fertilization, the quality seeds will provide the family with a good harvest allowing the crops to be sold for a higher price. The income of the family will thereby increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is a 34-year-old farmer from Gorelovka village in South Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife Irina and three children (16, 14 and 6 years old). The children go to school.

Mnatsakan is leading an agricultural business for the family, which is the main source of the income for them. The family owns a dairy farm with 15 cows. Mnatsakan and Irina produce cheese and sell on average 350 kg of this product locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the agriculture, Mnatsakan is busy with trade. He sells clothing in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 laris. 

Mnatsakan requested credit for purchasing clothing from the wholesale market. He will re-sell the clothing in the village for a higher price and increase the income of the family. Part of the profit Mnatsakan will reinvest in the same business to increase turnover, and the other part will be used for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомурод трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Он занимается предоставлением  транспортных услуг. Имеет собственную автомашину. На доходы содержит свою семью. В день он обслуживает много клиентов. Таким образом он зарабатывать на свою жизнь. Бобомурод запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Bobomurod is a hardworking and conscientious family man.  He is involved in providing transportation services.  He has his own car.  Bobomurod supports his family with the earnings from the business.  He serves many customers per day.  This is how he earns a living.  Bobomurod is requesting this loan to repair his car.  He relies on your kindness and help.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат разведен и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Более 5 лет он занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Имеет собственную автомашину. Полученные доходы помогают ему  содержать семью. Шухрат запрашивает займ для ремонта своего автомобиля. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shuhrat is divorced and raising three children.  He is a very hardworking and kind person.  He has been involved in transporting passengers for over five years.  He owns a car.  The earnings from the business help him to support his family.  Shuhrat is requesting this loan to repair his car.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат замужем и заботливая мать четверых детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Более 3-х лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции. В основном она выращивает морковь и лук. Супруг помогает по бизнесу и является членом дехканского хозяйства. Каромат хотела бы получить займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений. Каромат надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Karomat is married and a caring mother of four children.  She is a very hardworking and honest woman.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over three years.  Karomat primarily grows carrots and onions.  Her husband helps her with the business and is a member of a dekhan farm.  Karomat wants to obtain this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is going on with her food and household goods trading business in Ijevan city. 

Now she has her own shop, which Alvard and her family were able to construct thanks to their business. 

This is Alvard’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. Alvard spent her first Kiva loan to buy fruits and household goods for her business. Now she needs a $1,000 loan to buy candy, cereals, coffee, tea, canned foods, and various detergents to resell.

loans.use: to buy candy, cereals, coffee, tea, canned foods, and various detergents to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 48-year-old single woman supporting eight members of her family. She owns a bar, a business she started 25 years ago. She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks. This is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Esae

texts.en:
Esae is 51 years old, married, and has one adult child.  His mother also lives with the family.  He is lives in Alaverdi, South Georgia and is a farmer. His wife, Alvard, works as teacher in a local school. 

Esae is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. He grows potatoes, wheat, and barley on family owned land. Esae sells harvested products to local wholesalers.  Esae and Alvard also run a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Alvard makes cheese and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, which includes the pension of Esae’s mother. 

Esae is requesting a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. After fertilizing the land and sowing quality potatoes, the family will have a good harvest, which will be sold. The family will use the income for financing their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 34 years old. He is the father of five children and lives in a small village in South Georgia with his wife Tsitsino, children (6, 5, 4, 3 and 1 years old) and mother.

Agriculture is the main source of income for the family. The family owns a dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Nodar produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Also, Nodar grows potatoes on family-owned 0.4 hectares of land. The harvest is sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 laris, including social assistance, which the family gets from the government as a family with many children. 

Nodar requested credit for purchasing seed potatoes. He will purchase quality seed of a good sort, which will be sold for higher price. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to provide better care for their children, purchase necessary goods for them and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en:
Vakhtang is a 27-year-old farmer. He is from Balanta village, South Georgia. Vakhtang is married and lives with his family: wife Zinaida and two daughters (4 and 2 years old).

Vakhtang is leading his family's agricultural business. He runs a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Zinaida produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy, the family grows potatoes and carrots on a family-owned plot of the land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 laris.

Vakhtang requested credit for purchasing potato and carrot seeds, as well as fertilizers. After properly tilling and fertilizing the land, Vakhtan will count on a good harvest. After selling the harvest, the family will get a profit, which will be used for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and potato and carrot seeds

loans.name: Akarita

texts.en:
Akarita is 23 years old and married. She owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Akarita needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2012, Akarita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Akarita's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 44 años, es una mujer soltera. Cuidó de sus 2 hijos: Emerson y Yusely, sola. Los ama mucho y viven juntos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas. Gracias a su trabajo constante pudo lograr muchas cosas. Una de ellas es la venta de comestible, en su propia casa, ahí vende productos de primera necesidad como también toda variedad de bebidas de diferentes marcas y sabores, es la única que vende este tipo de bebidas por ello ya la conocen en su localidad. Además de poseer un ómnibus con el que realiza trasporte público entre las rutas conocidas de la ciudad, para ello contrata un chofer que se encarga del negocio. Pero la actividad que más satisfacción económica le dio; es la fabricación de ladrillos en una fábrica que tiene, ahí trabaja con ayudantes, a quienes les paga de acuerdo a la producción que realizan, cuanta que hace un promedio de 25 millares al mes y los comercializa en una feria reconocida, donde obtiene las ganancias de su trabajo. Ahora desea ver a sus hijos, realizados con una profesión y que puedan ser independientes y fuertes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mi banco” y este es el décimo octavo crédito con MFP, donde agradece al apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que obtendrá el préstamo que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues los integrantes de su asociación son responsables y solidarios. Olga de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los ladrillos y si el dinero le alcanza comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
44-year-old Olga is a single woman who has brought up her two children Emerson and Yusely on her own.  She loves them very much and they live together in their own home, in the town of Cajas.  Thanks to her constant work Olga has been able to achieve a lot, including opening a grocery business in her own home.  There she sells basic household products and a whole range of different brands and flavors of drinks.  She is the only person who sells these types of drinks so she is well known in her town.  In addition, she also owns a bus with which she provides a public transport system on known routes in the city.  She hires a driver to take care of this business.  However, the business activity that provides her with the most financial satisfaction is making bricks in a factory that she owns.  There she works alongside assistants who she pays according to how much they produce.  She says that she makes an average of 25,000 bricks a month and sells them in a well-known market.  This is where she sees the profits she makes from her work.  Now Olga would like to see her children with a profession and would like them to become independent and strong.

Olga is a member of the 'Mi Banco' community bank and this is her 18th loan from MFP.  She is grateful for your support because she will receive the loan that she needs to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time because the members of her community bank are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Olga will invest the money she has requested in buying raw materials for making bricks.  If the money stretches far enough she will buy basic household products to stock her grocery store with as well.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks and basic household products with which to stock her store
